Summary: Not the best stay. The hospitality of the staff was the best part. My room smelled like cat urine, there was mold in my sink, the faucet was broken and the  outlet by the sink where I plugged in the iron was not functioning and there was hair on my couch and in the tub.

LIKES: Close to airport Quiet Clean property Nice room layout Good sink/vanity lighting  DISLIKES: Room furnishings from the Reagan era Very slow elevators Vanity too small for more than 1 person  SUMMARY: Nicer than a recent Renaissance stay, this property was pleasant despite some shortcomings. The red sofa in the room was very dated, but at least the bed was comfortable. No airport noise despite being relatively close.  Breakfast was surprisingly expensive (essentially the same as the free breakfast served at Hilton Hampton properties) so I would consider eating elsewhere if possible.

This hotel was a few miles from the airport car rental return, which was convenient for my next day flight. Standard Courtyard property, has a Starbucks in the lobby where we ate breakfast  - it was ok. Limited outdoor parking, but they have a small parking garage behind the hotel.  My only issue was that the room had a smell - like either the bed covers needed to be changed, or perhaps the carpet cleaned.

Something illegal was going down at this hotel on the morning of July 10, 2022. There were were about eight people lined up in the hallways spaced out with several police officers monitoring them. This makes me question the safety of this hotel.   Also, left a unique charger. Called and left a message with their lost and found hotline- no return call. Left a message with the front desk, no reply. Finally on my second call to the front desk, they checked the lost and found with no luck. They said their procedure is to put any items found into a Ziploc and put it into a locked area for safekeeping. Something went wrong with this procedure, otherwise my charger would’ve been found. Totally my fault for leaving it, but a trust worthy hotel would be finding and returning lost and

Well maintained hotel in convenient OC location. We had two King rooms, and both were spotless and comfortable. Asked for balcony facing the courtyard and that's exactly what we were provided. Parking was convenient.  The staff was professional and friendly. We would stay here again.
Room tip: Best views are into the courtyard.

Summary: I am usually in Orange County once a month.  This hotel is close to where I need to be in Costa Mesa.  This property is huge and one can easily get lost.  The hotel room was very clean, and quiet.  The staff is very friendly and professional.

Summary Heading: Very Clean but Adhering to Policies Not So Much
Summary: We were here for 7 days over Christmas.  The hotel was very clean. Our room was spotless, the bathroom was immaculate and overall we were very happy with our room. The hotel does NOT offer complimentary coffee (they do have mini coffee makers in the room.), It would really be a nice addition if they did. The do have a very good breakfast if you care to pay for it. The people who work in the dining area are awesome!  The location is very near to The Villages at the Spectrum  if you are visiting family/friends who live there. A quick and safe walk over. Also, you can walk to the Spectrum Center Shops and restaurants.  About the Covid Policies:  I will say that there are postings about wearing masks. Most people wore them. Plenty did NOT. We had totally forgotten to mask up ONE

Summary Heading: Hotel Does Not Adhere to its Policies
Summary: On May 29th, I checked into this Courtyard and was very disturbed by the poor treatment and service.  I checked in after 11:00 p.m.  The regular night person was training a new employee.  I did not mind this so much but it took about 15 if not more minutes.  What disturbed me was an incident that followed during the  check in process. As they were trying to check me in,  another person came to the desk to check in.  The clerk at the desk explained he would help him after he was finished with me.  That was fine.  The gentleman barely stepped back or away from the desk.  Now there is a HUGE sign at the check in desk stating to social distance 6 feet.  Feeling uncomfortable,  I asked the gentleman to step back 6ft.  He refused stating that they have proven it doesn’t work.  A bit
Room tip: Unpack your bags from your car during registration, because you will have to walk far from their ...

Summary: 30 years of business travel and this property has got to be one of the worst. How it's possible to screw a basic Courtyard model I will never understand? The staff here as a whole, but more the females have such low IQ and lack basic ability to perform their basic job functions. They have had very little training and zero ability to provide the most basic customer service tasks needed. You need to call 6 times to get towels etc. They love Covid and use it as an excuse not to have to work and do their jobs. Almost no one is staying at the property so you see the staff sitting around talking a lot with each other or on their phones. No room cleaning the week I was there, no food, and to get clean towels or the wifi to work is multiple calls and waiting 5-6 minutes for the front

John Wayne Airport Courtyard was easy to get to and from the John Wayne Airport in Orange County. Comfortable stay, the rooms are nice and staff is friendly. I would stay there again when visiting Orange County, CA.

Summary Heading: Lovely Courtyard - great for business stay
Summary: Beds were comfy, cafe served good food and drinks promptly. Lovely sitting by the fire after a long day work with my colleagues. The rooms could use a little updating (swap out the old carpeting for laminate or something) but as a whole, it's a great hotel. Would stay again.

Stayed here on a business trip. I liked the ... courtyard ... in the center of the hotel; it was a good place to sit outside, and the fire pit was enjoyable. They were able to accommodate my early check in. I was not thrilled with the first floor room though; it felt like I was sleeping too close to the sidewalk. I actually booked this hotel in error; my colleagues were at the other Courtyard by the airport.

i have stayed at this hotel for business several times now and have never been disappointed. It is comfortable, close to the airport for convenience, they have a free shuttle to and from the airport, their lobby is perfect for meeting or just relaxing and the staff is pleasant and always happy to help with anything you need or wish for.

Stayed here recently before a flight out of Santa Ana.  The hotel isn't near any restaurants so you will need a car or a ride.  The staff is helpful and friendly.  My family enjoyed the outdoor pool and the grounds were clean and inviting. They have an airport shuttle that you either have to schedule or call ahead for, which is convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay! We always strive to the best customer service and are open for suggestions on how to improve. Glad to see you enjoyed your stay and look forward to you visiting again soon!

Summary: Booked 2 rooms for 5 nights. Great access to 405 freeway John Wayne Airport and close proximities to restaurants and shopping. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. I am a repeat visitor! Fire pit is nice feature which my wife loves!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay! We always strive to the best customer service and are open for suggestions on how to improve. Glad to see you enjoyed your stay and look forward to you visiting again soon!

Summary: I live in the area and we lost all power to our home on a Friday evening due to an Edison sub station catching fire.  Initially, 24,000 customers were w.o. power including John Wayne Airport.  It has been very hot a humid.  Saturday, still no power and I was feeling quite ill due to the heat.  I telephoned the front desk at the hotel and was initially told there were two rooms for the night.  I said I would take one.  The lady transferred me to a gentleman who then informed me they were sold out and that Marriott would not take a reservation.  I told him that the woman just told me they had 2 rooms available.  He again said no.  I then asked for the Manager and Kyle picked up the line.  I explained the situation to Kyle and he said that I could have a room for 2 nights, not one

Summary Heading: Great Everything except for the Mattress
Summary: Jenny at the front desk  was wonderful. She was so helpful, welcoming and accommodating. Just what we needed after a 2 hour drive.  Our room was beautiful and spacious, overlooking the pool with a small balcony (it was also spotless). We had a suite so there was a small refrigerator and microwave too. Nice shower new shower with quality bath wash, shampoo and conditioner. We were very comfortable. We enjoyed the bar (quality liquor options) and had a margerita flatbread which was delicious. Really nice barstaff. The other menu items looked great too but we had dinner plans so we just needed an appetizer. There is comfy outdoor seating by the fire pit which is a nice touch too.  The downside for us was the bed. The mattress was so hard it was like sleeping on a board. I couldn’t

Summary Heading: Fine if you're skinny and are wearing comfortable shoes
Summary: Typical, nice Courtyard with everything the same as all the others (down to the picture of the leaf hanging in the bathroom) with two exceptions: 1-the shower is about 26 inches wide with a glass door, so if you aren't skinny, you aren't going to fit (and even if you are, you are going to bump your elbows on both sides). They do have nice, full-sized bottles of tea tree shampoo and conditioner in the shower though (although no lotion anywhere). 2-the parking situation is unique. There are a few parking spots by the door; otherwise you have to park in the garage behind the hotel, which is quite a walk, and not a fun one in heels. You also have to pay $10 a day to park there (which they kindly waived since I am a gold member and I wasn't so happy about my feet hurting me). There
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Great stay with exceptional customer serivce.
Summary: This was a good hotel. We enjoyed our stay. But, Jenny at the front desk was one of the most helpful and friendly reps that I’ve ever dealt with. I travel for a living, and have rarely run into someone so helpful and friendly.  I’ll be back.

This hotel is just average.  My room was on the 1st floor facing the parking garage.  There was a lot of noise coming from inside the hotel (above, neighbors, hallway).  The room itself was adequate.  Nothing was really great, nor was it bad.  The room was a little dark.  They did have one of the most aggravating things I have seen, the hallway, sink area, and bathroom lights are on sensors, thus the lights turn off automatically, and very quick too.  That did not help the already dark room.  I am paying for this room, I should be able to keep the lights on if I want to.   The Bistro is expensive and not that good.  I got a cookie in the evening, the guy just went to the fridge and gave me a cold cookie.  No offer if I wanted it heated up, he really didn’t even want me in front

Summary Heading: Great location and very attentive staff
Summary: This hotel is located right off the 405 and 1 exit away from the airport. Great location for an early departing flight or late arriving flight. Lots of office buildings around.  The front desk staff (Jenny and Catherine) are very friendly! As well as the younger guy at the Bistro.  Clean rooms and I always receive an upgraded room.  Have suggested this location to many co-workers.

I would say that I agree with the rest, just fine - good enough.   The rooms just need updating, refreshing and the a/c unit is just too loud/antiquated.    I wouldn't stay there again and not up to Courtyard standard.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and I am sorry to hear that you had an issue with your a/c unit. We do replace and/or repair the units as issues arise, our apologies that we did not catch the problem prior to you.

Summary: Our room seemed like a mile from the front desk. Oh, what to comment on 1st. Lets start with the bed.   Its like jello and squeeks. The TV reception was so bad I just turned it off. I was awakend by the man in the next room, snoring, coughing and an occasional passing of gas. Seriously I paid $10.00 to park to experience this. What a Circus  Oh yes. Almost forgot. No hair dryer, no coffee maker.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and will be looking into the issues you have brought to our attention.  I would like to find out the room you were in to check the bed as we are known for great beds at Marriott.  Our standard rooms do come equipped with blow dryers which are located in the closet directly behind the vanity area.  We also provide coffeemakers along with all of the condiments. We do apologize that your stay was not up to standard.  Please feel free to contact me directly at (949)757-1200, if you would like to discuss further.

Summary: I did 2 rooms reservation i got the confirmation# just for one but not for the other one , the next day call to confirm my 2nd reservation and was nothing on file try to get on touch with someone took ovet 30 min to tt to the customer service representative she sd there is no 2nd reservation so i got transfer to another person and no luck she told me i can do it again but with a diferent price ( more money of course)  adv to the person from customer service the price was totally different than today it was less money and its not my fault so finally i have to get out of work it took more than an hour to go back and resolve all this situation. Even explain i got a screen shot from my phone regard the price. .
Manager Response: Hello, I am so sorry to hear about your reservations experience.  I would be happy to help you, feel free to give me a call at the hotel.

Summary: Stayed here on an overnight work trip. Convenient location near the airport. Nice patio area and the hotel has a nice lobby with Starbucks inside. The room was clean, but kind of dated and just meh. I think if you’re on the courtyard side you’d love this place. After traveling by foot down two very long hallways, I found my room on the first level with a sliding door staring out to the parking garage. Didn’t exactly feel the safest. So I called the front desk and there weren’t any rooms on the inside of the hotel. Not wanting to lug all my stuff back to the front I decided to stick with it.   All in all, a decent place to stay. The room made me want to give a 3, but I wanted to be fair there really isn’t anything wrong with this hotel and the rate was reasonable. I’d stay again

Summary Heading: This is a Clean, Convenient and Comfortable Hotel
Summary: We stayed at the hotel during a weekend family trip. We didn't have time to use any of the facility except our room, which was clean, convenient, and comfortable.  The hotel is located within a quick drive to many local shopping and restaurants (lots and lots of nearby choices).

Nice hotel close to everything in Irvine. Fashion Island mall just down the street on Jamboree.   Staff fast, friendly, and efficient.  Lobby very spacious as is the bar area. Plenty of parking    My only gripe is that they have sensor switches in the rooms with timers.  Entryway lights have very short duration

When we checked in the Lady was friendly and courteous. Our room was comfortable and quiet. Plenty of parking was also available. The hotel was a little difficult to find the way into the first time, and close to the freeway. I gave it 4 stars because it just didn’t feel like it deserves 5 but there was nothing wrong with it.

1st time here after many trips to Irvine. My new favorite hotel here. Shuttle from John Wayne Safe/quiet neighborhood $6 Uber to office Clean and well decorated for an old style courtyard Cafe has soild breakfast Great restaurant right out from for dinner

We had a last minute trip to Irvine and had to book a room with Courtyard Irvine. We have stayed here before a few years ago and the standards are still the same. The room was clean and comfortable. It is close to SNA airport and shopping centers. The staff are friendly and very helpful.

Great facility, just a few blocks from the Irvine Hotel where we cancelled a reservation.  Nice spacious lobby with a small Bistro inside.  Staff was quick to check us in and the room was like new.  Not sure how old the facility was but looked fairly new and fresh.  Enjoyed our two night stay.  We ate two meals at the Bistro, fresh and fast service.

This is a great hotel for those on business travel and wants to stay near John Wayne airport. Shuttle service to the hotel is available. Like any other Marriotts, the lobby is a great place to hang out, have a beer or food, you can conduct meetings.

Summary Heading: YMCA shower.  It’s not fun to stay.
Summary: If you wax nostalgic for showers at the YMCA with soap dispensers built into the wall of the shower then pack your rubber shower shoes and stay here.  Otherwise, stay somewhere that is not so cheap and tacky and can provide actual bars of soap and bottles of shampoo.  I am sure the hotel will say, “But this is high-end product yadda yadda yadda.”  Fine, if you can afford to provide high-end product the old “low-end” stuff again. There are few luxuries at a Courtyard, but taking away bars of soap is going in the wrong direction.  Courtyard has also changed their Bistro menu and have removed everything I used to order.  As a Platinum for life stayer at Marriott with 2000+ nights stayed, it looks like I have outgrown the Courtyard.  I expect better from a Marriott Courtyard.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback about your stay.  The new dispenser systems in the showers are actually designed to be environmentally friendly, minimizing the waste and thus the carbon foot print from Marriott.  We do still have individual bottles of products and bars of soap available should you be back at our hotel. Please let us know and we will be happy to deliver them to your guestroom.  We do appreciate your loyalty to Marriott and value your Platinum Elite status.

Summary Heading: The Bath Tub Shrieks When One Takes a Shower
Summary: The hotel seems to have been renovated recently.  The room is spacious enough, but the bathroom layout is rather odd with the sink outside of the bathroom, directly across the clothes closet.  It creates a clash of doors when the closet door and the bathroom door are both open.  The bath tub seems to be installed rather loosely.  It shrieked each time I stepped and moved around in it.  I read an article recently that hotels are doing way with little bottles of shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and replacing them with wall-mounted dispensers.  This is the first hotel in the Marriott family that I have stayed in that have made such a move.  The dispensers looked new, so there was nothing disagreeable about them.  I do love the new shampoo and conditioner that Courtyard offer; the
Manager Response: Thank you for the review of our property and most importantly, thank you for making us aware of the issue with your bathtub.  We will have our maintenance team fix that problem right away.  We have had great feedback regarding the new dispenser style bathroom amenities and we do have processes in place to ensure they are clean and full.  We thank you for your stay with us and we cannot wait to have you back as our guest.  Happy travels!

Summary: After staying at the hotel during a business trip in April of 2018, I arrived home to discover I had received bed bugs from this hotel. I had a cluster rash on my arms and legs and had to see a walk-in clinic for treatment. I contacted the hotel and they brushed me off and did not care. I checked online and this hotel has a history of bed bug problems but refuses to take accountability. The hotel itself has a nice lobby and restaurant, but the rooms and hallways are extremely dated. Due to my bed bug encounter, I would not recommend this hotel by ANY means.
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize that your call to the hotel to discuss the issue you experienced was not handled appropriately.  Please email me at karlyn.bretz@marriott.com, I am the General Manager and I will assist you with this issue. We do take bed bug claims seriously and I wish to do that for you.  I apologize that this is not the response you got when you first called. I look forward to hearing back from you.

Summary: At arrival: Empty soap  bottle in shower 🛁, refrigerator door not shut tightly so wasn’t cold, hairdryer had dirty handle 😝, ducks swimming in pool waddling around pool 🏊 duck droppings (Even though aviary enthusiast ... concern is sanitation,illness,risk of exposure)   Bed 🛏 very comfortable and clean - great mattress   Creeped out when received call about midnight asking if I was alone and did I want company??!!  I hung up phone thinking wrong room (awoke from sleep) then call to desk to report after thinking 💭 couldn’t trace origin, was in-house call 😕  All reported to desk, receptive to input, was told notifying housekeeping manager, no information regarding midnight call 🧐  Offered idea used at Beach 🏖 properties to keep aviary friends in safe locations - seemed
Manager Response: Thank you for the review Lisa.  I am so sorry we failed to meet your expectations.  I apologize for the problems you experienced and they will be addressed with the appropriate department managers, so we can prevent these from occurring in the future.  We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you the next time you are in Irvine.

Summary: Don't book any rooms here. Housekeeping are thieves. I booked a room for the weekend and left a bottle of $85 cologne in the room when I checked out. I called to let them know and the front desk man said they found it and put it housekeeping. When I called to pick up the cologne, Louis in housekeeping suddenly didn't have the cologne. When I talked to Jim, he changed his story to saying they never found it. I would not trust these guys ever. I am currently on hold with their customer service department for this matter, I have been waiting for 30 minutes so far. They really have no value in their customers other than to pay for rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is Kyle and I am the Operations Manager at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.      On behalf of the entire team at Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Irvine.

Summary: We had to stay the night in the area on a holiday weekend for business. We had called a few hotels and were unable to find anything reasonably priced. So we drove inland from the ocean a little. We just happened to see this hotel from the main street and pulled into the hotel at close to 9pm. We were greeted by two friendly hotel clerks and were checked in quickly and easily. We asked for a room with a king size bed and were surprised that the room also had a sofa and a very nice table and desk. The room was clean and comfortable and had all the amenities we needed for the night. They even had tea tree shampoo and conditioner in the shower. We were hungry and decided to order from their bistro which was open until 10pm. The soup and quesadillas were very good. Our room was on

We checked into this hotel on Wednesday, December 27, 2017 after 7 pm. It was a very slow day after Christmas. There were not many guests in the hotel because the parking lot was empty. One of the registration staff checked us in. The check-in process was nice and pleasant. The lobby area looked clean and in order. When we got into the elevator, it was a different story, it was filthy and dirty. You can see that the hallway carpet that led into the elevator has not been cleaned for a long time. We got to our room, left all of our luggage there without checking out the room and quickly left for dinner.   We came back almost 11 PM after dinner. My husband was sitting on the couch to watch TV and falling to sleep while I was getting into the shower. The moment I got into the
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County and providing your honest feedback.    Providing the highest level of hospitality and cleanliness is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent issues like this from occurring in the future.   Thank you again for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.

Summary Heading: No service from the staff. Noisy.
Summary: The property follows the same theme as other Courtyards.  The good:  Fairly clean. Internet speed. The bad:  Our sink is broken. We asked the staff to fix it at 8am. As of 9pm it is still broken.  We asked for additional towels to be left in our room for the second morning but the did not leave any.  Tonight we have a large group in the courtyard below our room. It's 9:30pm and they are drinking and loud. We called the front desk to ask if they could do anything. We were told that it would be impossible for the hotel to do anything "as they have no control of the guests using the courtyard". For $150 bucks a night I would really expect better service than this. I would look elsewhere unless you are desperate as there are a huge amount of hotels in this price range that will be
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us here at the Courtyard Irvine.  I am so sorry that your sink was not fixed in a timely manner.  Our Courtyard is a central part of our hotel and a common place for social gatherings.  We do monitor the area for noise, and ensure that guests are not out there past 10:30pm. If you are noise sensitive we would recommend an exterior facing room for your stay.  We appreciate your business and hope to see you in the future.

Summary: We checked in about 7 PM. The lobby is very welcoming. We were checked right in and went to our room. Two nice big queen size beds. We went out to dinner and returned back around 9 PM. The hotel is very quiet. Had a great sleep in the bed was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Just one night for a connection trip
Summary: We stayed in this Courtyard hotel for one night. As we expected, there's no free breakfast but it's not an issue at all. There are so many nice places in Costa Mesa/Irvine area, such as JJ Bakery or 85C Bakery.  We heard kids running around at the night. Probably will not come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for you feedback.  Please accept our apologies for the children running the halls.  We do our best to patrol and ensure this is not an issue, I am sorry we fell short of our goal to provide a comfortable stay for you.

Summary: This is a nicely updated Courtyard hotel, pool, bistro, nice workout center. The staff was very nice and helpful. Had a problem with the AC, they were up within 5 minutes and got it working. The process are all over the place, but that's typical of hotels like this, demand drives the price. I wish Courtyard would just get decent towels. These are system wide so bad, it's almost embarrassing. The location is very close to the airport and easy to get to. Parking garage in the rear of the property, stop and get your key first, it's a walk all the way around the building without a key.

Like Visiting Family! You Come in , get the Smiles, Warm reception,  and Aloha Spirit all in one Stay! Good Location, close to Freeway and Eateries. Although , you should absolutely make a point to visit the Bistro; and it's impeccable service by Julio the Man. Get greeted by Hospitality and Professionalism, by Yutzee the Leader!!  Will definitely be stopping by for some of that Irvine Love and Marriott Standards of Excellence!  Thanks Again to the quality team of Genuine Customer Service🙇‍♂️🤙👏

My regular Irvine hotels were booked out for a convention so I stayed here. Rooms need to be remodeled Carpets need replacing Mildew smell in many places Front desk screwed up my billing and my wake up call - trainees need better supervision Never again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County with us.   Delivering a memorable hotel experience is a key priority, I am very sorry that your stay fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Irvine.

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was even better than the first time! We stayed on the ground floor and had a room facing the courtyard. Spent several relaxing evenings on the room's patio and courtyard.  We will definitely stay again as it is easy to get to from the freeway and close to UC Irvine. Staff at the Bistro was always pleasant and helpful no matter what time.

Had to take a taxi from the airport to hotel, but they reimbursed it! Staff was okay in handling registration, bed was okay, linens and room were clean! Thanks for proving complimentary coffee. The hotel is also close to Andrei's and good restaurants. The hotel housed many attendees to a conference which is about 3.5 mi away only. We asked if they can bring us there, bit to no avail!

Great hotel. Have stayed here twice now. Convenient parking. Staff is friendly. Outdoor pool is nice. Very close to John Wayne Airport so easy to get to. Located near anything you need during a stay. Two thumbs up!!

Convenient to the airport. Less than 10 minutes away. Easy access to the 405. Fashion Island & restaurants of several different types & prices minutes away. Pacific Coast Hwy less than 20 minutes west on Jamboree Blvd.

I stayed here 4 nights, while in town on business. I found the property to be immaculately maintained, both inside and out.  This is a very good Courtyard property with plenty of balcony and walk out rooms. The rooms are of a prior generation décor (not the latest silver & grey motif), but still very nice.  I rated them a "4" due to the excellent condition of the property, friendly professional staff, and free parking (separate parking deck behind the property). Further, the property is only one exit south of the Orange County Airport, and it's really convenient to the interstate.  The location is good, you can walk to a couple or restaurants, but you are only a 5 minute drive to just about any type of food that you would like.  The only drawbacks to the property are the facts

Nice hotel. The staff was very welcoming and very nice to my young children. They are able to help with any question I had. My only complaint was a small amount of mold or mildew in the got in the shower. Other than that the girl was perfect.

Summary Heading: More Like a Fairfield Except in Price!
Summary: I spent 4 nights at this hotel. The price varied each night but averaged to about $190 per night. I have stayed in $100 a night hotels that were every bit as nice, with free breakfast, but of course not in Orange County! But still. Let me say that the grounds and gardens were lovely. But my room was quite small, and had a musty smell. The carpet appeared old, and had 2 good size holes, they look like burn holes, maybe 1 by 2 inches in size. The bathroom is quite small, with a sink outside, with very little counter space. I had a tiny balcony overlooking busy Jamboree Rd and a parking lot. When I tried to open the screen door it fell off.(Easily put back) Coffee packets were not always replenished by housekeeping- an irritant at 5 am as the front desk was a long way from our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County.     Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Irvine.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issues that you recently experienced while staying with us. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.

Summary: Great Marriott location near all the big businesses and walking distance to the airport.  Close to some decent places to eat and the room is very spacious and very good bed.  Love the service here and enjoyed my stay, they do have a great coffee station and backyard with fire pit.  Very nice lobby too.

Summary Heading: Not Bad, Not Great, convenient location
Summary: One of Marriotts objectives is to deliver a consistent experience. This place is that, with nothing either good or bad standing out. Breakfast over cooked and barely edible. Room well equipped, although iron was missing
Manager Response: Hello Ed B, Thank you so much for taking the time to comment regarding your stay. I am so sorry that we were unable to deliver a great stay for you.  Please feel free to reach out to me directly regarding your breakfast experience in our Bistro. We hope to have the chance to try and deliver an exceptional experience for you in the future.

Summary: The service was excellent. The rooms were comfortable, fairly roomy, and quiet.  Especially those away from Jamboree Rd. The Bistro was a pleasant surprise. Reasonably priced with a limited but varied menu. Servers were very accommodating.  The entrance is off Main St.  heading northwest (Look for sign) you have to make a right and then another quick right and down a lane to get to the lobby entrance.  There is parking in front but limited, however, their parking structure is well lit and easily accessed. Will definitely stay again when in the area.

Summary Heading: good except for the noise that goes on all night
Summary: no obvious construction but it is now 1 am and still trying to get to sleep and it is like someone is picking up and moving an empty metal dumpster every 5 minutes - have stayed here before and was happy but this is beyond ridiculous
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear that you did not get sleep during your stay with us, I can certainly understand how that would make for an unpleasant stay.  There is currently no construction at the hotel or that adjacent buildings. I am not sure what the noise could have been.  If you ever experience something like this in our hotel again, please notify the front desk immediately so that we may investigate and correct the issue for you.  Your comfort is our number one priority and we apologize for the problem.

Summary: Typical Courtyard setup....you know what to expect.  Centrally located at Jamboree and Main.  Free parking is in the back and separate from building in covered garage.  Next door is a business tower with a upscale restaurant.  You will have to drive to most places.  I would stay here again.

The room I reserved online wasn't available so i was upgraded to a bigger room. I thought that would be a great start to our stay but it went down from there. The room was nice but first thing we noticed was a dead roach near the door in the main bedroom. The first day housekeeping never came. I had to go to the front desk to get fresh towels. The second day housekeeping came but the dead roach was still there. Later that night when we came back to our room there was a roach crawling down the door. My daughter was freaked out by this and afraid to put anything on the floor. The light switch didn't work in the main bedroom and our last night there the door handle actually came off! On a good note, the breakfast is amazing!! My daugther would have liked pancakes or waffles but
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport/Orange County with us.   We pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels; we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your guestroom fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping and maintenance teams in an effort to improve our service, and ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Irvine.

Summary: Very clean. I stayed here for a night. Plenty of parking. The hotel is difficult to find as you turn into the driveway, it is behind corporate office buildings. You have drive about 800 feet before you see the hotel. There is no fridge. There is a coffee bar and food in a cafe for purchase downstairs. The food is a bit on the expensive side. This is one of the best hotels for the price.

Summary Heading: Nicely appointed hotel, close to highways and airport
Summary: This Marriott Courtyard is conveniently located adjacent to highways and expressways and near Newport Beach and Balboa Island.  It is nicely appointed and modern, the rooms are a good size and well furnished.  John Wayne Airport is less than 10 minutes away making it great for an early morning flight.  There's a small outdoor pool but it was rarely occupied.  There's also a small strip mall across the street for a quick bite.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, I would return if in the area.

When we travel to southern California we stay at this hotel to ensure a calm environment and a one hour drive away from major theme parks. The rooms have always been clean and have enough outlets for all your devices. You have a good size television and enough channels for all the family to enjoy. In the lobby you have a luxurious waiting area with a Starbucks. The pool area is organized and attractive for kids to use. The Spa room has dumbbells and 3 cardio machines. The downsides, first, the parking is located in the back of the building. If you have small kids or elderly, you might face many challenges when moving to your room. Second, all the elevators are not functioning which again might be a change for certain people. Finally, restaurants and gas stations are not nearby

Stayed for a week on business in December.  Location of the Courtyard is OK, with shops & restaurants within a few minutes drive. Staff were really friendly & helpful, and check-in was very straightforward. The bedroom & bathroom were big (by European standards) with a kingsize bed, sofa, decent size desk and a huge TV. Bathroom had a small tub with a decent shower over it.  There was a small bar serving snacks & a limited breakfast. I tried the braeakast, but choice was limited & price  meant not-so-good value. Also a small Gym & pool which were free to use. Free covered parking and an adequate Wi-Fi were also included in the room rate. Overall, I would recommend this as a "much better value" alternative to more glitzy hotels, and convenient location or the airport (they run a

My husband and I recently spent two nights at the Courtyard Irvine on Main Street.  The room was spacious, modern and very clean.  The bed was very comfortable with crisp bedding and quality pillows.  We only wish that some of these higher priced hotels would offer a complimentary breakfast as many of the other hotel chains offer.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments regarding our hotel.  I agree with you that our new linens are amazing.  At this time, Courtyard does not include breakfast in the room rate, however on weekends we do have a Stay for Breakfast rate package available which include complimentary hot breakfast in our Bistro.

Summary: Been here a few times - always a great stay.  Comfortable, clean room and friendly staff. Great location for my business purposes.  Easy access.  Comfy bed and nice courtyard to relax in the middle of a busy city.

Summary Heading: A great residence in a major socal city
Summary: The rooms are great, but can be a little noisy from the traffic. The front desk staff are great. The evening bar/restaurant is very basic. I found that some staff seemed bored operating the bar and they resorted to playing with their 'phones. But, all in all it is a good place in a good location. The business center is good too!

My mom and I were surprised at how comfortable the beds were! We both slept so soundly which is a rare treat for us.  The bistro meals we had were fresh and tasty.  The coffee barista could use more training, otherwise it was one of the best rooms of our travels.

I thourally enjoyed my stay.  The room was very lovely and clean.  Had everything I could want.  I slept great, the mattress was very comfortable and I was very happy they had soft pillows as well as firm.   It was close to the beach and everything I wented to see.  The staff was courteous and helpful.  Looking forward to staying there again.

The hotel is conveniently located about 10 minutes away from the John Wayne Airport and offers a free shuttle service there and back. It is also about 3-5 minutes away from the 405.  The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.  Some of the rooms are located on sides where there may be excessive noise.  I stayed on a side facing a building where they were moving furniture out at 9:00-10:00 at night, which normally would be okay except i was on east coast time not west coast time. this was very loud.

Summary Heading: Convenient to Airport, Relaxing Fire pit
Summary: As far as convenient, this location provides shuttle service to/from John Wayne Airport every hour or by special request.  The hotel is located about 10 minutes from the airport on surface streets, so no extra long time needed for departure.  The hotel layout provides for some relaxing quiet areas outside of your room, for yourself or a small group to meet.  The outdoor patio/pool area is quite relaxing with a firepit in the evening - perfect place to literally kick up your heels and relax with a beverage of choice.    My room was another story - it took 3 rooms to find an adequate one.  The first, had a stench of chemicals as if they removed crime scene evidence just the day before.  The second, was next to the air duct system - that is in dire need up cleaning or upgrading or

My past 2 stays at the courtyard have been subpar. Both times I was emailed a review survey which I completed and was offered an apology from irvine and a "you're a crazy liar" From ATL. You'd think if you take time from your day to complete their satisfaction survey and reposed with why you were not satisfied that  they could throw a few bonus points in your account and make you feel like your opinion mattered. I don't see why they send out the surveys if they don't even acknowledge when the stay wasn't up to par.   The courtyard in Atlanta left a really salty taste in my mouth but this review is for Irvine.   The front desk staff was excellent and friendly at check in, they always are and they're not the reason I avoid Marriott courtyards whoever possible.   My room was not
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing additional feedback.  I am happy to hear that you were pleased with our staff.  We take great pride in delivering a pleasant experience for all of our guests, and I am sorry we fell short during your stay.  I am truly sorry that there were dirty towels on your patio and around the pool area.  You comments were given to the housekeeping department and were addressed by the housekeeping manager.  I am sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at the  Atlanta, Ga. Courtyard by Marriott.  Please let me know if I can be of any further assistance.

Summary: This hotel is easy to access from freeway, local restaurants as easy to reach, and it is only 10 minutes to the airport. My first room had some malfunctions and the staff was very quick to arrive at my room and move me to a room across the hallway.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The beds are bit used and slope to the center, but still comfortable.  The Bistro offered great breakfast options.  Being on a major corner did cause a lot of rush hour traffic noise in the morning which was annoying, especially when I had an interior courtyard room.  Highly recommend it!

If you are only in town for the evening, this hotel is great. It works as a nice place to stay before you leave for the airport or right after you get in from the airport. The John Wayne shuttle service is on time, so do not be late or you will be left behind if there are other passengers waiting. The staff is friendly and the property is clean and in a good, safe area.

The place was clean and the staff was attentive.  I was assigned a king room at check in, however I needed a double room. The staff quickly accommodated my request and was given a new room.  The parking at the hotel is free, which is nice for the area.  Overall, a really good experience.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: The staff at this location is very friendly and helpful. The rooms and beds are very nice,  the bathrooms could use a little updating, but still very clean and usable. The tile is pretty dated and could use a facelift.  The corridors and room entry doors are also dated.  Every other aspect of this property is great, the food is good, and for an onsite restaurant, it was reasonably priced.  Parking is easy, covered and free.  the location is in the heart of Irvine and close to the several businesses.  Overall a great experience.

I'm sitting in the lobby right now, drinking a Starbucks and waiting for my delayed flight. I've had a different breakfast every day for 5 days (all tasty and fresh) and every query I've had has been greeted with a smile and fully resolved straight away. The rooms are spacious but not huge, the beds are comfortable and clean. Water pressure in the shower is decent. Fitness room has a couple of treadmills, a bike and some floor space with weights and the pool is big enough to do more than three strokes per length. Handy for the airport and many office blocks locally but also close to shopping and decent restaurants. If I need to work in Irvine again I'll definitely be coming back to this hotel.

Comfortable and clean rooms. Staff is VERY friendly and tried to get to know you if you're there for a few days. The fitness center is decent and the options in the cafe and room service are standard courtyard. Also have a nice happy hour special.

Summary Heading: Very basic hotel, bad front desk service
Summary: Basic service hotel, but expensive due to proximity to John Wayne Airport.  Front desk personnel are not attentive and some downright mean. Showers and sinks have the stingiest possible flow restrictors that I've ever experienced in CA - barely stronger than those cooling misters at amusement parks (hint, unscrew the shower head for a "hose" shower).
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay here.  We are a select service hotel, and the services we offer are in line with the services offered at all Courtyard by Marriott hotels.  I'm sorry that you did not have favorable interactions with our front desk staff.  Please feel free to contact me directly to discuss further.

Summary Heading: My go-to place for Orange County business trips
Summary: For several years now, whenever I've needed to overnight in Orange County for business, this has been my primary home. It's not the cheapest but not the most expensive; service has been reliable and consistent on every trip. It's a well-maintained Courtyard.  Rooms are quiet, the Internet works, and the parking is free. You're five minutes from the airport if you need to race out in the morning.

.....I asked the front desk to call me a taxi to LAX and a black SUV arrived.  I said that I just want a regular cab to which the reply was "this is all I could get" I asked the driver if he was on a meter and he said no it's $170 plus tip. I negotiated this and got into the limo when the driver asked me for my room number. I am assuming that this means there is a tie up between the hotel and Speedy Car Service. I asked the driver if this is the case and he said the hotel always calls that car company.  I understand that I could have refused the cab but this review is to recommend caution when asking the hotel to book a cab.
Manager Response: Hello Andrew, Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your transportation to LAX.  I am so sorry to hear about your experience with the service that was called.  I appreciate you bringing this to my attention as the hotel does not partner with any specific companies or drivers.  Typically, we call local companies to see which is available and set that up for our guest. I will address this with my staff to ensure that they are following this directive, and most importantly to ensure that we are meeting guest requests for the type of service.  If you would like to discuss further, please contact me directly at the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Location Near Airport
Summary: This Courtyard is only a couple miles from John Wayne Airport. And it is only 8 miles to Newport Beach and 14 miles from Laguna Beach. Hotel was very clean, the room was very large and very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and roomy. The service/staff was exceptional! It has a pool, and an outdoor lounger area
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay here in beautiful Irvine.  We appreciate the feedback and look forward to your next stay.

Summary: This has been my Go To hotel when I fly into John Wayne.   Typical Courtyard, but very close to the airport and major freeways.  Friendly staff.  Cool fire pit area in patio is nice on summer nights.  Free parking is also a nice perk.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review.  We are very happy to hear that we are your "Go To" hotel.  Thank you for your loyalty and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Checked in for the night before a trip to Mexico. Asked about leaving my car while I was away for 5 days. They let me leave it in there garage and gave me a shuttle ride to the airport. Didn't charge me for the service. The room was perfect and they have a nice little café that was better than expected. Counter people were very helpful when I needed to check on a reservation change.

Summary Heading: BEST COURTYARD I HAVE BEEN TO
Summary: location was exceptionally clean all the staff was freindly & helpfull / nice courtyard with firepit / rooms were great  some city traffic noise ( slows down after rush hour ) fast bus to airport great place to stay

Summary Heading: Even the Duke (John Wayne) would like it!
Summary: Excellent service.  Quick pickup at the airport.  Clean property.  Good breakfast.  Very good exercise facility.  Convenient location.  What more do you need on a business trip?  I chose this hotel because it is a Marriott brand and located close to the Orange County airport.  Their shuttle service was very prompt and the driver very courteous.  I will certainly stay here on my next trip to Orange County.

I stayed here during a business trip not too long ago and I had a wonderful stay.  The hotel staff were all very kind and accommodating, especially when I arrived quite late at the hotel for my stay.  The suite was very clean and overlooked the outdoor pool which was just gorgeous.  It also had a private, outdoor patio with some chairs so one could sit and enjoy the view.   Outside, there are places to sit around the pool, along with a large and comforting fire pit with gorgeous tiles.  Inside the main lobby, is the typical Courtyard dining area with comfortable seating, computers, etc.    The food was delicious and everything was made very quickly, especially in the mornings when everyone was in a rush to go to their respected places.  They also brew Starbucks, and I am a much

Summary Heading: Nice people but old, run down property
Summary: Old, run down hotel. Some of the rooms and some of the corridors smell like toilette. Management is nice and understands the problem and will address it. The location is central but if you're on the wrong side you get the street noise. For those of us who've stayed at Marriotts all over the place, don't expect the same quality, mainly because of the smell which probably has to do with the pipes, plumbing.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us.  The issue you encountered has been addressed and corrected.  We hope you will give us another chance should your travels bring you back to Irvine.

Summary: We stayed at Courtyard for 3 nights, the hotel located in well lit, quite and safe business area..The check in was seamless. Staff was friendly, helpful , the room was clean and well maintained, wifi excellent, would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review of the hotel.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you next time you are in Irvine.

Summary Heading: Great landing place before moving on
Summary: Like most Courtyards, you will find a comfortable bed with warm helpful folks interested in making your stay relaxing. I suggest you venture into Irvine and eat at San Woos or a number of great Chinese eateries that speckle the area. One night or one week here will be a nice experience. It is a Gotta Go kinda place IHG, RUBE
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words regarding our property.  So happy to hear that you had time to explore, Irvine has so much to offer in the way of unique dining.  We look forward to having you stay with us the next time you return to Irvine.

Summary Heading: Convenient to SNA and local businesses
Summary: This hotel is situated next to two large offices buildings, so if you have any business in this area, stay here.  The hotel is not really new, but is nice and looks well maintained.  The layout of the hotel is a little strange, the building is built u-shaped, with one end being the restaurant and front desk, and the rooms down a long hallway which turns down another hallway of rooms.  You can only get to the last hallway of rooms through the one hallway unless you want to walk across the courtyard by the pool.  Not so great if it's raining.  The rooms are nice, with fairly quiet air conditioning and a decent amount of space.  The best part of this hotel from my perspective is the proximity to the business office I was working at and the SMOKING FAST WIFI! The staff are very
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel.  We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in Irvine.

Summary: I just needed a place to stay for one night near airport. It has a lovely lobby and rooms are nice. Carpeting in areas is a little run down. My shower didn't work and the staff comped me a breakfast and got me a key to next room over which took this from a three to a four. Excellent staff. I'll stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  My apologies for the problem you encountered with your shower.  I am happy to hear that our staff was able to take care of you and make things right.  We appreciate your business and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: A Consistently Good Place to Stay
Summary: Over the last 8 years, I have stayed on and off at the John Wayne Airport Courtyard by Marriott.  They have done some more updating and the old, dirty drapes are gone.  Furnishings are much more stream lined and clean.  It remains a comfortable place to stay and usually it is very fairly priced.  it is also safe.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind review and your loyalty to our hotel.

Summary: As many people have mentioned before this is an old property. But the advantage is its proximity to airport, office buildings and also eating joints. When I went to this place in early October 2015, there was construction work going on in this place. The first thing which I noticed was the parking lot building was located behind the hotel. The time I was there, I guess the property was full and all my requests in terms of room requirements (location, floor etc.) were turned down. I had to live with what was available. I do not have anything to complain about the service. Overall, it is a nice place, but will I chose this hotel again if I am visiting this area again... probably not.

I stay at many Courtyards and I have seen better and worse. The hotel has a nice external appearance but not obvious to find at night since it is surrounded by office buildings. The hallways and rooms were tired but clean. It is very convenient to the airport and the front desk and bistro staff were pleasant.

My family and I recently stayed at the Marriott-Courtyard in Irvine, CA.. It wasn't the nicest and comfortable stay we have experienced. We are regular customers of the Marriott hotel and have not experienced any inconveniences whatsoever until this recent stay of ours last Saturday, 10/10/15 at 2701 Main St. Irvine CA. 92614 Room #247. Our previous stays with the Marriott has always been nice and comfortable.  It was disappointing what we had experience recently and I just want to inform you so that something can be done or this can be fixed.   Upon our arrival, we checked-in. The front desk clerk didn't greet us or acknowledge us. Not even a smile on his face. He just asked for my Identification card, asked us how many keys and told us where our room was. I noticed when I was
Manager Response: Dear Allan,  I sincerely apologize for all of the problems you experienced during your stay with us and appreciate you bringing them to our attention so they may be addressed.  I assure you this is not the norm at our hotel.  I see that you are a Marriott Rewards member and appreciate your loyalty to our company.  I have awarded your account the points equivalent to a one night stay at our hotel to apologize for the problems you experienced.  If you should need anything further please feel free to contact the hotel and ask to speak with me.  Thank you for choosing Marriott.  Sincerely,  Karlyn Bretz General Manager

Summary: Clean, spacious, great views, the noise cancellation between the walls are phenomenal. I wish they did have a microwave tho, but they've got a fridge. Balcony overlooking the pool,  STARBUCKS, opened all day, a nice Bistro, stylish furniture down in lobby and did I say clean? I'm a very observant, meticulous, over analyzing 29 year old female and I guess u can say I'm a little clean freak.. I always have to carry Lysol wipes to every hotel I go to and I personally wipe down the phones, doorknobs, light switches, remotes, etc before I use them and this place passed the "white glove test", and that's clean. Definitely passed Summer's (my) Standards.

This was the last night stay in California before heading back to the east coast.  Not a typical airport hotel.  The rooms, and overall appearance was good.  The front desk staff, drivers, and Bistro were more than happy to help.  We appreciate all the great customer service from Calli, Jen, Elizabeth.  You made our last night wonderful.  A great hotel to stay at if you want to be near the airport.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words, it was a pleasure serving you both!

Summary Heading: Daughter soccer games at Irvine university
Summary: Drive into the parking lot and hotels landscape was nicely maintained. Front desk was fantastic really made you feeling good. They were very accommodating...the room was good clean sheets and looks like the cleaning staff is very detail not even any dust.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us for the soccer tournament.  We hope to see you next time your daughter plays in the area.

Summary: Good location if you are on a business trip. Quiet place with fast and reliable room service. Food at the restaraunt downstairs is pretty good. Laundry service, mini-bar, and thick curtains - all you need to get some sleep when jetlagged
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review.  I am pleased to hear that our hotel provided what you need for an enjoyable stay.

Summary: This is an older hotel, but is in the heart of downtown Irvine (if there is one).  There is a Starbucks inside and the Byul coffee is down the street was great.  Several restaurants are within walking distance or a short car ride to The District, Diamond Jamboree, or the Marketplace.  Close to the airport as well as many office buildings.  The fitness center is small and there is a pool, but the only bathroom at that level is on the other side of the hotel, past registration.
Manager Response: Glen P,  thank you for the review.  It was a pleasure serving you and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Older and dirtier Courtyard, close to John Wayne airport
Summary: I stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to the airport. Parking is free and it's close to the airport which are both positives.  The thing I noticed most is the lack of cleanliness of the hotel. This hotel is still outfitted in the older orange brown theme and the carpets look stained and dirty to me. My room was also disappointing. The floor of my bathroom was not clean and needed to be deeply sanitized. Again, if you need to travel in and out of John Wayne, this hotel is very convenient. Again, don't expect a first rate Courtyard. But it is an ok place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel Michael.  I am disappointed to hear about the cleanliness issue with your guestroom floors.  We have addressed this issue with housekeeping and I want to assure you that this was an isolated issue.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you when you are back in Irvine.

Summary: The guest room was cool, quiet and clean; a welcome respite from the traffic around Irvine. The property was well maintained and offered an onsite Starbucks. It is a great hotel for easy access to spots around Irvine.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review Anna.  We look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: Stayed 4 days. Comfy bed, clean room, and everything in good working order. Starbucks downstairs was so convenient. Free parking in their own garage. Nice pool area.. Should think about having a restroom there so you don't have to run upstairs in a wet swimsuit.  Every room has a balcony. The bathroom was a little tight, and the water pressure was not do great. Overall, a great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review, I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: I stayed here for ease of convenience to UC Irvine. Complimentary parking, no free breakfast but Starbucks in the lobby... clean, well-lit rooms. Didn't use the pool, hot tub, or fitness room but they are there and looked fine! I have also reviewed the Residence Inn down the street, but this time I didn't need the extra space and saved $100 night by staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We look forward to seeing you the next time your travels bring you to Irvine.

Summary: We have stayed in many of the hotels in the area. While the courtyard is clean & the room & lobby is nice, the rooms are ok size. However, I prefer the Hampton or even the residence inn. This is just a single room w/king or 2 queen w/sofa bed & no breakfast included .. At the Hampton for less money, we have a separate bedroom w/living room, 2 TVs, breakfast included. Also there is always tea   Coffee , water available at the Hampton ...we only stayed at the courtyard b/c we were using points. So ok for 2 guest .. If you want more room.. Stay at the Hampton or residence inn!

Location is best suited for those doing business or visiting friends/relatives nearby, or else there isn't much to do. Nearest shopping is about 10 minutes away.  Very standard experience, consistent with what you would expect from a Courtyard hotel.  Free parking is available at the front porch and the parking structure behind - look out of the designated structure for Courtyard guests to avoid getting charged for parking.

Summary Heading: Good location and amenities for a business stay
Summary: This Courtyard by Marriott is just a few miles from John Wayne Airport and is conveniently located in the business district on the west side of Irvine. It is also relatively close to Newport Beach, Costa Mesa (including South Coast Plaza), and Santa Ana.  The lobby area is similar to most Courtyard by Marriott's, and includes a Bistro area, a small lounge area, and a decent size television. The outdoor area has a pool, additional seating, and a firepit.  The fixtures in the room were a bit dated, and the shower head was not near as good as most Marriott properties. The bed was very comfortable. The sound proofing was not that great as I could hear the TV from the next room till it was turned off after 1:00 am.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback; we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: Courtyard by Marriott, Irvine, California by John Wayne Airport in Orange County; address: 2701 Main Street, Irvine, CA 92614, Telephone: (949) 757-1200. This is the place to stay if you and family are in Irvine, California. Highly recommend this establishment, the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean; the pool and Jacuzzi areas also very clean and kept with extra towels to be used by guests. This hotel is a non-smoking facility!! What is really awesome is that the pool and Jacuzzi areas close at 11:00 pm. The grounds are well maintained and clean. The breakfast is extra, but they do have continental or full breakfast, also A La Carte. And for the price value it is exceptionally Worth it and very reasonable. Also ample parking and

Summary Heading: PLEASE READ FOR ALL FUTURE GUEST IF INTERESTED :)
Summary: Hi there,  Thanks for taking your time to read my review. This is by far the WORST EXPERIENCE at the MARRIOTTS.   I went in to inquire about a potential stay as a person that enjoys the Marriotts hotel.  One of the staff name OLGA has the worst customer service ever. When I entered the property I wasn't greeted even though she saw me come in and just looked at me. There was another staff near her name Janice. Not one of them even said hello or ask if they can help me? This is a HOSPITALITY business and what is this??? Unprofessional. I walked up to ask her if she had a corner upper room available ( very kindly by the way) and she said i can't help you and can't guarantee any room until you make a reservation. WHICH IS FINE.. I don't know the protocal of the business BUT it's her
Manager Response: Again, thank you for bringing all of this information to our attention.

Summary: The rooms have been renovated (2 years ago) but they are outdated. The AC units are the old wall units (super noisy) and the amenities (soaps etc.) are bare bones (no body lotion even)  The gym is awful! super small and only one rack of dumbbells and 1 bench. 1 elliptical and a few other machines but its very small and there is no way to turn off the overhead florescent lights.  The rooms and hotel was very clean though and the staff was nice. Also free parking is a plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments regarding your stay  caramarie.  You are correct, our rooms were renovated about two years ago, and we will be undergoing another lobby renovation this Fall.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our staff, and the free parking is always an added bonus, especially in Irvine.  As with all guest supplies,  just let us know and we can always deliver more to your room if needed.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Beautiful room at a very reasonable price
Summary: The room we stayed in was a beautiful room, clean, and smells clean.  The maids refresh the rooms during our stay and I would say they do a good job.  Parking was not a problem.  The price per night was reasonable.  The bed was very comfortable and the comforter was soft and clean.  I love the white bed cover.  Where did they buy it?  I want one.
Manager Response: I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us here at the Irvine Courtyard.  The bedding can be purchased at shopcourtyard.com.  It looks like they are also on sale right now.  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to having you as our guest again soon.

Summary: We stayed for one night before our flight out of SNA.  Rooms were clean and price was right.  The bar/food area was nice and had plenty to offer.  The pool was good, my kids loved that they had funoodles.  Only draw back was the wifi didn't reach the pool area.

After several hours of airline delays I ended up at this Marriott for the night. Starting with the shuttle driver and the front desk staff ; this hotel stay was above average. It turned a hectic day into a pleasant and satisfied evening.

This is a very nice Courtyard.  It seems to have been recently renovated as everything seemed new, modern and updated. It is a great looking property. The check in was seamless.  Staff was friendly, helpful and seemed happy to see me! I read some other reviews and don't understand the confusion about parking.  There is plenty of parking in the garage behind the hotel and it is free.  If you are lucky enough to get a spot in front, congrats, but otherwise not a big deal to pull around the hotel each day and park in the back.  The hotel is amazingly close to SNA.  I had a rental car and an early 7 am flight on a Monday;  I got to the rental car return in under 10 minutes from the hotel. Rooms were very comfortable, quiet and the property is very clean, kept up well and a nice

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel by SNA airport
Summary: Arrived at SNA with no hotel booked, went out to the Shuttle bus area and asked the bus driver for the Marriott Irvine about staying at their hotel and how much it was for the night, he didn't know but he was very helpful and took us to the hotel and walked us into reception and spoke to the receptionist about getting us a good deal,  wish I could remember his name was an older chap worked their about 20yrs he said, probably the most friendly shuttle bus driver I ever encountered in the USA !! The room and rate was good, about  $120 a night I think it was, we got breakfast thrown in as well. The room was very nice, Internet was quick, co complaints there at all. Breakfast the next day was very good as well,  helped myself to Bacon, Eggs, fruit, cereal and Coffee !!

This is a useless hotel. I wouldn't stay here unless you have a meeting RIGHT at the hotel.   I was in town for work -- my meetings were being held about 1 mile away, so I figured the Courtyard would be convenient and a nice option. And to be fair, it is similar to every other Courtyard I've stayed at - felt like deja vu walking into my room, it was just like one in San Francisco. Reasonable bed, clean, simple.  But getting to and from the airport was another matter. I was just in town for 1 night for meetings, and figured I'd just use the hotel shuttle and cabs to get around -- now I know it would have been infinitely easier to rent a car. The shuttle option from the airport was nonexistent, and I had to take a cab. When I was headed to my meeting the next morning I decided to
Manager Response: Hello Jenn D,  Thank you for your feedback regarding transportation to and from the hotel, and the surrounding areas. Unfortunately, our shuttle is only insured for trips to and from the SNA airport.  Local cab service is one option for getting around town.  We do log times cabs are called, which company has been reserved, and arrival time.  On occasion, the cabs are late. I am so very sorry this was the case for you.  I can understand how frustrated you must have been trying to get to your meeting.  We do make every effort to call reputable cab companies and drivers when requested.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations in the future.

Summary Heading: Airport near hotel, read for parking advice
Summary: Stayed at this location after a late flight to the west coast. Just off a main road that had some good restaurants, I stopped by a subway to grab a quick bite on way to hotel.  Got to hotel around 10 and parking is a little funky. When you pull in front there was short term parking available. When you drive around the back of the building there is a garage so I pulled in and wound up paying $12 to park for the night. As I walked to the hotel there is a Marriott garage just past the one I pulled into, not sure if there is a charge (assume so) but signage was not obvious.  Then I walked around hotel to realize I came around the wrong side and had to drag by bag 3/4 around the hotel to get to the front desk.    After a long flight it would have been nice not to do that. Really need
Manager Response: Greetings Tom,  Thank you so much for staying with us here at the Courtyard Irvine, we appreciate your business.  I am sorry to hear that you had to pay to park in the corporate structure for the adjacent building.  Our structure is located directly behind our building and parking is always complimentary.  For anyone that has never been here before, we recommend checking into the hotel first, then parking.  Once you are checked in, you will have a key that will give you direct access to the hotel so you do not need to carry bags to the front entrance.  Hopefully this will help future guests.  We thank for your feedback Tom.

Summary: Marriott Courtyard in Irvine near the John Wayne airport may not be the cheapest place to stay but it is by far the best value.  Reasonable price for the area, high quality rooms that were recently renovated and places to eat nearby along with a good exercise room.  I tried them all over the course of months and in the end I cried when this place was full and I was forced to go elsewhere.  Save yourself time and just stay here.

Had a business meeting at this location in February. Location is convenient to John Wayne airport as well as eating and shopping. The staff was very well organized and our meeting went very well. The Bistro was one of the most well-managed of any Courtyard we have used for our meetings.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post a Trip Advisor review for our hotel.  I have shared your comments with our events team and they were happy to get such positive feedback. We look forward to hosting future events for you.

Summary: Great stay! Hotel is extremely clean and quiet. Staff are very friendly and helpful.     The only thing bad I can say about this place (if you want to call it bad) was I called to ask for late check out since I was running late to get back to the hotel to check out on time.  They allowed a late check out time but failed to let me know that my room key would not work.  So I had to drag all my belongings that I was holding all the way back to the front desk to get my key fixed.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  My sincerest apologies for the key issue, I'm sure that was very frustrating for you.  I will use your experience to make sure that our guest service representatives are retrained, and that future guests do not have the same experience.  In light of that situation, I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and I hope we see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Good location also for vegan/vegetarian people
Summary: We were here for MLK weekend. Stayed for a 3 day spiritual conference which was within a 5 minute drive. We drove from San Francisco, CA.  We loved the location as it was near freeway 405 and a lot of vegan/vegetarian restaurants.  It was good that they had free parking, since many of the hotels in Irvine charge for parking. They also had free wifi.  Loved the reception area, rooms were good. The only negative was that they didn't have a safe box for valuables so we had to take all our valuables everywhere we went and no free breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review of the Courtyard by Marriott Irvine John Wayne Airport.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the complimentary parking and internet.  There are some pretty amazing restaurants nearby, that's great you got to experience some of the local fare.  The hotel does have several safety deposit boxes located at the front desk, these are complimentary as well.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: If you like the smell of McDonalds than this is the place for you as the smell goes throughout the hotel including the rooms. We had four rooms, one had hair in the sheets and one had dirt in the fridge. The only good part about this hotel is the free wifi. The business center is a very limited software. You cannot open your email if you have "too many emails" according to the front desk lady. And you can forget about sending an email to as I tried 3 of the four computers and the constantly exited out as soon as I was ready to send it. I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your stay.  I am sorry that you were not satisfied with your stay at our hotel; I assure you the situations that you experienced are not commonplace at the Courtyard by Marriott Irvine.  If you would like to discuss your stay in more detail please feel free to contact the hotel and ask to speak with the General Manager.  I would be happy to discuss your experiences with you, so that we can assure these situations are not experienced by another guest.

Summary: Only stayed for one night so we could make our early morning flight. Liked how convenient it was to John Wayne Airport and the free shuttle service - couldn't be more than 10 minutes away.  Room was very comfy - told my husband I sure like Courtyard beds.  Had a sandwich in their Bistro Restaurant for dinner - very good and a quick breakfast before heading to the airport.  Everything felt updated and clean.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  Courtyard does have amazing beds and you can actually purchase them for your home at marriott.com .   I am happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay and I look forward to seeing you here again.

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel and I recommend it to others!
