Summary: I stayed at this hotel last Saturday night just for one night as we extended our trip but our other hotel wasn't available. I have to say I wish I'd just have booked this hotel for all three nights! Property was well kept, check-in was clean and nice modern style, room itself was great, even had a little balcony but I didn't try to go out there.   Staff was great and I was able to get my coffee from their little cafe in the hotel lobby. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Courtyard by Marriott Irvine.  We pride ourselves in making memorable experiences for all of our guests.  I appreciate you filling out a review for us and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Great location. Updated hotel, very nice. Staff is friendly, airport shuttle, good for-pay breakfast. Not many restaurant choices if you don't have a car but Uber is the best choice for getting around. Nice lobby for hanging out if you have down time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review of our property.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to seeing you soon!

Summary: Super quiet, great service, clean, easy parking and super easy access to John Wayne airport (no need to get on the freeway).  Bistro/Starbucks on site - always important :) .  Will definitely stay here again when flying out of SNA.
Manager Response: Hello Karen,  Thank you so much for posting your review of the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport.  We are glad to hear that our location and amenities met your expectations.  We look forward to seeing you when your travels bring you back to Irvine.

Summary: Special thanks to Sophia, Cindy and Francis they mad our stay more fun and exciting 👍 we amended our stay 3 times and mad it's so easy to remain a gust. The view and environment all day and night so Cousy and friendly. I will sure visit again soon.
Manager Response: Hello Wahleed,  I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Courtyard Irvine John Wayne Airport.  I will make sure to acknowledge our associates on the terrific service they provided during your stay.  We look forward to having you stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Exactly What You Expect From a Courtyard Marriott!
Summary: I've stayed at more than a few Courtyard Marriotts and some are this good, and some are surprisingly bad (i'd stayed at better budget hotels). This is at the top end, for sure. Very clean. Super great location if you're flying out of John Wayne (or just getting around the OC). Great parking, check in was a breeze, they have a vending type area to buy snacks and a bar/restaurant that's open most of the time. Rooms are on the average to slightly small side (but who needs a huge hotel room?), beds are comfy, huge tvs (maybe a bit too big for size of room). Clean, bright bathrooms.   Free wifi!--and not 'free in lobby' or any of that normal hotel smoke and mirrors. They also have a computer set up so it's easy to print out boarding tickets or anything else you may need.  Just a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of the Courtyard by Marriott Irvine.  We are pleased that we were able to meet your expectations.  We look forward to seeing you again when your travel plans bring you to Orange County.

Summary Heading: Centrally Located and a Nice Big Suite!
Summary: Stayed here for a friends BBQ nearby. The Courtyard Irvine is very centrally located, off the Jamboree exit on the 405 corner Main, and near a lot of restaurants, grocery stores (Ralph's on the same street), and that famous bakery called 85*C which has a long line of people out the door every weekend! The check in is a breeze, the lobby is nicely laid out-people have breakfast and coffee there in the morning. There is a business center, and a family room type setup. Outside you can go to the pool and jacuzzi, which is the centerpiece of the hotel that wraps around it. For a few dollars more, we got a huge suite, and it was worth it! Especially great if you have family with young kids or travelling with a group of friends. Even for business, the living room can function as a
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind review RichieSel.  The bakery 85' is amazing, right?  Well worth the wait, and a must go to when staying at our hotel.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay here and were able to use some of the amenities.  The suites are great for families, it is so nice to have the two TV's and a separate room to spread out.  We look forward to having you stay with us again when you are in the area.

Summary: I only stayed here for a single night over a quick weekend trip to Irvine. The hotel was conveniently situated only a few minutes from the highway, shopping, and a bunch of restaurants. I got into town a little bit early and was able to get an early check-in. Parking (free) was somewhat limited with some spots up front and a small 2 story parking garage in the back. The room was very clean and looked newly renovated. The bed was VERY comfortable. The staff was very nice and accommodating. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Very friendly staff. They have shuttle for local offices. Stayed there only for one night and hotel was very clean and modern and bed is comfortable. Wifi signal was not very strong and kept disconnecting.
Manager Response: Hello RGCertified, Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our staff and the accommodations.  I am not sure why you experienced connectivity issues, but we will look into the problem immediately.  Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Hotel-5 on a 10 scale but the employees were nice to chat with. Pool nothing special and the hotel was about 8 miles from the airport . clean, but the price was excessive for what was received.  It was however convenient for visiting our family
Manager Response: Hello Jeff,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and services.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your interactions with our staff, we take great pride in our associates and believe they are our greatest asset.  I'm not sure which airport you are referring to in your review, but we are less than two miles from the John Wayne/Orange County/Santa Ana Airport(SNA).  Being that we are in such proximity to the airport, our rates are slightly higher than a typical Courtyard.  I can assure you that our pricing is very competitive for the surrounding area.  We hope to see you again when you are in the area for a family visit.

Summary: I have never stayed at Courtyard Marriott. I am a bit of a hotel snob, I usually stay at 4/5 star hotels. This time, we just needed to stay overnight after a wedding we attended. The hotel is very clean and modern. The bed is comfortable. The sheets, comforter, towels, shower curtain is bright white. The bathroom tile grout all over are very white. This is a very well maintained hotel. I would definitely consider staying at Courtyard for short term needs in the future.
Manager Response: Hello RN90,  Thank you for such a honest and kind review of our hotel.  We are always happy to convert a self professed hotel snob to the Courtyard brand.  One thing that you will find among the Courtyard brand is consistency among hotels.  We hope to see you again when your travel brings you to the area.

Summary: I am a boring creature of habit at times but when something works why change it. On business I stay almost exclusively at Courtyard by Marriott and find them to be consistently good--service, friendly, food, clean, convenient. The Courtyard Irvine is no exception. I have been welcomed, well served. I would recommend and I will return.

Summary Heading: Ok to stay for a little while
Summary: I think the hotel is overpriced for what offers. Room was nice and clean. TV did not have any kids channels other than PBS. They say wi-fi it's free, but I could not receive/send emails from my iphone while I was there. We were there for just one night. I asked at the front desk if we can use the pool. They said yes, but when we went there, the doors were closed and a sign was letting us know that the pool is under maintenance. Called front desk and the receptionist apologized for forgetting to check before. Gym Room is tiny, tiny with just 3 machines, however, nice and clean. There is a bar in the main hallway, where you can order a breakfast ($4.00 oatmeal) or a lunch, but everything seemed very expensive. A water bottle in the room $4.00. Parking in front of the hotel is very
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us at the Courtyard Irvine. We appreciate your feedback and use it to further improve our property.  Our sincerest apologizes for the pool being under maintenance during a portion of your stay, we understand how frustrating it can be to look forward to an amenity and not be able to use it.  In regards to pricing at the Courtyard Irvine, we are competitively priced as compared to other hotels within the John Wayne Airport area.  Again, many thanks for your feedback and we hope we get the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Location was perfect and great service!! Room was clean and had a great experience!! The rate was great and I had compared it to other hotels around it and it was the best price! I highly recommend staying here if you are ever in the area!

Summary Heading: Sleep with Bed Bugs at your own risk
Summary: Sunday night May 18th, 2014 woken up early morning with 30 to 40 bites on my back, a cluster of red bumps, itchy and bleeding.  I don't feel good, and will be going to doctor tomorrow.  Front desk manager, Jennifer Seibert would not even talk with me face to face in the morning.  They called me to say they had housekeeping investigate, and of course they didn't find anything.  My emails to the General Manager, Karlyn Bretz have been ignored with no reply.  If you search similar complaints from Marriott you will read how it is protocol for all Marriott hotels, they simply deny all claims and responsibility.   I will no longer be a customer of Marriott hotels.

Summary Heading: Top Marriott Brand option in OC
Summary: In the OC you have overpriced Irinve Marriott and several other lack luster courtyard hotels, but this one was my favorite.  Parking is free (Irvine $20) rooms are spacious, and the pool area is sunny with good public areas.

Summary Heading: Not full service, but good quality & value
Summary: it is a Courtyard so service is less but quality is consistent and clean. The desk staff and restaurant staff are very responsive. The fitness room leaves a lot of be desired. 5+ for their pricing model of not nickel-and-diming with parking fees.  So overall four stars for price to quality, consistent experience and no hidden fees.   Would be five stars if the exercise room was updated.

I can't say enough about this place. It's modern, clean, comfortable beds, great service toboot. Location is about 3 miles from Orange County Jphn Wayne. The only con (if you would consider it a con) is the parking. It's located in the back of the hotel. Depending on where your rooms, it can be a long walk.    Definitely would stay there again.

This is a very good hotel. The hotel was well maintained. The location was excellent to beaches, restaurants, airport,etc. The staff was very nice and pleasant. The room was large and very nice.It was also very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed in June 2013 for a graduation at Irvine.  Clean rooms, quiet, and  nice breakfast. Free parking is always appreciated. Located close to everything we needed to get to. Staff was nice. Would stay again.

Stayed for a week on business in March. We have used the Marriott nearby on Von Karmen Ave in the past, but their prices (including"extras" such as parking) were getting a bit scary. Location of the Courtyard is OK, with shops & restaurants within a few minutes drive. Staff were really friendly & helpful, and check-in was very straightforward. The bedroom & bathroom were big (by European standards) with a kingsize bed, sofa, decent size desk and a huge TV. Bathroom had a small tub with a decent shower over it. Aircon worked well. There was a small bar serving snacks & a limited breakfast. Also a small Gym & pool which were free to use. Covered parking and a slow-but-adequate Wi-Fi were also included in the room rate.Overall, I would recommend this as a "much better value"

Summary Heading: Everything was great but our room
Summary: We stayed at RI in Newport Beach and didn't get a good nite sleep there so we decided to move to this one.  Staff were nice and lobby was really nice but room was a typical small hotel room.  We stayed on top floor but there were so much of crackling noise from the roof that we hardly had a good nite sleep.  We normally stay across the street at the RI but that RI changed to cat. 5 so we couldn't use our reward nite there.  Otherwise, we would have stayed there instead.  Next time, we might try another floor instead of top floor.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with the Courtyard by Marriott Irvine.  We appreciate your comments and we will look into and address the creaking noise you experienced on the fourth floor.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott in Irvine for one night in January.  The hotel was very nice.  The front desk staff was very helpful and the room was clean.  I had breakfast at the hotel and it was good.  The location worked out very well for me.  I would recommend this hotel.

Free beer Monday through Thursday in their cafeteria area. Excellent location down the street from a very busy Asian shopping center that includes: 85C a well known  Asian bakery, lollicup, Guppy House, and many more.  Rooms have an odd bathroom setup but the staff is fantastic and very friendly.
Manager Response: Hi Matt!  Thank you so much for your review! We really appreciate your loyalty to Marriott and look forward to welcoming you back soon. I believe you stayed with us at our sister property, Residence Inn by Marriott, John Wayne Airport. This property is right across Jamboree and does host a hospitality hour Monday-Wednesday evenings!   Thank you again for staying with us. Katelyn Olmstead

Summary: The rooms were your typical Courtyard rooms, perhaps a little larger than some of the newer hotels.  There was some construction but they made sure it did not interfere with our stay.  Parking was free and very convenient.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  One strange but very inconvenient quirk to this hotel - no ice machines.  We had to go up to the front desk each night to fill up our ice bucket.  They were happy to do it but we were in the back of the hotel and it was a bit of a walk.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time a writing a review about our hotel. We take great pride in our hotel and are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: This hotel was centrally located to restaurants, stores, and the John Wayne Airport.  The Wi-Fi was pretty lame, but the accommodations were very nice and very clean.  Parking was free and covered.  Paul Mitchell shampoo and conditioner.    I would recommend whole-heartedly.

Clean , Courteous , and Comfortable - this courtyard delivers on its brand promise . Staff was helpful and the shuttle bus from the airport was timely. The outdoor fire pit is an added plus...I haven reservations in recommending this courtyard
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We looking forward to welcoming you back to the Irvine area soon!

Summary: Came in for one day for business and his hotel was real convenient coming out of Orange County Airport. Rooms were really nice and room service was very good. I had the hamburger upon arrival, but honestly it needed much more taste. Some subtle seasoning would be nice.   No reason not to stay here and price is real good as well.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time out to write great detail comments about our Hotel. We definitely appreciate the feedback so that we may grow and learn as a team. I will be sure to pass your comments along to our Bistro team and look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: An aging hotel but great location, rooms....
Summary: The Irvine Marriott is down the street and around the corner from John Wayne Airport. Great location for this trip.  My room was large, comfortable, very good (if a bit boring) TV, a king size bed and a large bathroom. But, the room feels old. A complete reno should be coming up soon, I hope. As I was on the concierge floor, there is a buffet style breakfast....very good. Then they open the lounge again at four for three hours. The wine selection, liquor is great but so are the prices. The apps are enough to be a light meal for some people. The staff in this lounge are super.  Now downstairs. The desk personnel get five stars from me. helpful, knowledgeable and go out of their way to accommodate. Ryan, one of the front door staff drove me to South Coast Mall and returned right
Manager Response: We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay at our sister property, the Irvine Marriott. The Courtyard John Wayne is just a few blocks away and we do offer a shuttle to and from the airport. Thank you for your review!

Summary: Typical Marriott Courtyard hotel with a great location. The people at the front desk were very pleasant and upgraded me to an executive ste. since I am a Gold member. Ask for a room with a courtyard pool view.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: While a nice property, I was stunned to be informed that their shuttle goes only to and from the airport. I was told that their insurance does not permit any other destinations!  Most business hotels will drop their guests within a certain radius of distance. Additionally, I called the front desk at night to change my wakeup call to an hour later -- but received no wakeup call whatsoever.  Based on thus waking up late, I was slightly late to my local business training course that morning, though I then did get dropped off enroute to the airport.   I changed hotels the next night to the Hilton at SNA, where I received impeccable service and support.   (I'm Marriott Platinum Elite.)
Manager Response: Good Afternoon!  Thank you very much for taking the time to write feedback about our hotel. We definitely appreciate the comments so that we may grow and learn as a team. Our shuttle does operate strictly to and from the airport because we experience such a high demand of airport travelers. We are happy to schedule a cab in advance to ensure you arrive to your destination in a timely matter. I do apologize for the wake up call incident and I will be sure to follow up with our Front Desk team on proper procedure so this does not happen again to any of our guests. Once again, thank you for staying with us and providing great feedback. We hope to see you again in your future visits to the Orange County area.

Summary Heading: Marriott is upgrading several of their facilities which limits services
Summary: The hotel is located in the midst of several large business complexes.  There is nothing in the way of shopping, food or entertainment within walking distance.  The hotel restaurant and bar were under construction and the service was very limited.  It was impossible to custom order a meal. The staff was very friendly and cooperative, and even provided shuttle service to other restaurants as long as they were not over a mile or so away which limited choices.  BEWARE: the cash machine in the main lobby.  Several friends who used the machine had their accounts hit for additional charges.  The management was notified, but have no idea if anything was ever resolved.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, it is much appreciated! I apologize that our dinner options at the Bistro were not as customized as you would have liked. Next time you are in town, we do have Andrei’s in the same parking lot as our hotel. It is a warm, inviting place to visit, for lunch or for dinner and we recommend this option daily to our guests. We hope you come back and visit us again soon!

Summary: If you're flying out of John Wayne Airport this is a great place to stay. Free shuttle service to airport, plenty of parking and quiet, very clean rooms and friendly helpful staff. Excellent quiet pool, free on site wifi. Rooms have been recently upgraded. Lots of good restaurants in the area.
Manager Response: We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for choosing the Courtyard Irvine Airport and we look forward to welcoming you again soon!

Summary: I stayed here with my teenager for a soccer tournament. The location was close to many family dining option as well 5 mins driving to UC Irvine. We had a quiet and relaxing experience between games. We especially enjoyed the pool and the convenience of a refrigerator in our room.
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. It is always our hope for our guests to relax, rejuvenate, and fully enjoy their stay with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I arrived at the Orange County Airport at 9pm on a Sunday and within 30 minutes their complimentary shuttle had me at the front desk and quickly checked-in. The room was very comfortable and surprisingly quiet.  The onsite outdoors pool was as good as any I have seen from a Courtyard....I'm a swimmer so trying to swim a mile will still make you dizzy!    Breakfast was reasonable and tasty each morning and the common area was attractive and spacious...consistent with other Courtyards' quality.  The location was particularly convenient ...walking distance to office towers where my business meetings were located.  Many restaurant options were located within a mile or two although there more than 1 excellent restaurant on the same block. For my Wednesday return to the airport I
Manager Response: Hi Paul, Thank you so much for your note. We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: The rooms and the hotel are well maintained.  Staff is helpful and friendly.  Rooms were well situated and clean.  For a place to sleep and prepare for travel to food this is good.  Save your $20 and get breakfast from (pretty much) any other location.   But, you will find better food almost anywhere else... Microwaved, premade 'food' that is best left in the freezer.   The wine (by the name I drink at home) was quite bad too.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your recent stay at the Courtyard Irvine Airport. I am certainly disappointed that our breakfast was not to your liking with both our Bistro and Market options. I was glad to read you felt the staff did an outstanding job during your stay. Once again please accept my apologies and feel free to contact me directly in regard to your comments. Katelyn Olmstead

Summary: We arrived at 12 am. The staff was still energetic and helpful. The hotel room was clean, nicely decorated and very spacious. The stay was very quiet and comfortable.  The hotel was located in the heart of the business area of Irvine. It is very convenient for business travelers.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We take great pride in our hotel and hearing your comments really make us happy. Thanks again!

Summary: Stayed in this Courtyard for 14 days. Is middle-of-the-road standard hotel in the Courtyard family, and does not stand out too much from others I have been staying in in the US. The hotel hallways do not appear to be the cleanest I have ever seen but that may have been a combination of lights and carpet. Biggest downside is that the internet connection is worthless and for business I could never stay in this place. Internet connection in the rooms on laptop and mac book is shady and luck of the draw to get connected (and stay connected!), but for iphones the reception of internet is absolute something to be ashamed off. Spend one hour on the phone with AT&T support and in the end their only advice was "if you want to have iphone wifi just stand next to the door of the room", or,

I stayed here a previously for business trip to Irvine, overall, the experience this time around was somewhat of a letdown. The first time I stayed I booked the breakfast package for 2 ($20 upcharge) and had a pleasant stay and nice start to my day. This time around, I had booked my room with the breakfast for 2 (about $20 upcharge), needless to say, I was disappointed. Not sure if the gal at the lobby café was overwhelmed by the morning rush, but had to pay additional $20 for breakfast (to get what I wanted). It seems that this time around, the breakfast coupon only include a small coffee, and a crappy selection of a breakfast entrée.   Too bad...my most important meal of the day cost my wife and I $40, for something comparable I could have bought for $15 at Mimi's Café. Ugh!

For a hotel that caters to business travelers the rooms in this hotel are tired and rundown. The new updated lobby is staffed with slow and bad service and wifi access at this hotel is atrocious.   The service is very bad and if not in a convienent location would not have stayed.

My husband and I always ask for a quiet room in a quiet location and we got what we asked for...as far as the hotel could do in the choice of room they gave us. Unfortunately, the gang on the other side of the hall did not realize how loud they were as they came and went from their rooms, so when they were gathered for the pre-departure round-up it was noisy. The room was a typical Marriott room. The Starbucks downstairs has a great turkey and egg white breakfast sandwich. Other than the inconsiderate neighbors across the hall create a ruckus, we enjoyed our stay here.

Although the location, amenities and rooms were very nice, the service i got from the front desk is in need of help! I believe the front desk staff is one of the first impressions of a hotel, as too, the valet and bell service. The front desk clerk did not offer a map or direction to the room or to self parking and no information of the hotel. I purchased something from the store and the same employee failed to give me a proper receipt or tell me how much my total was for the purchase. I had to ask for the amount and proper receipt.

This property met Courtyard current level of expectations very well.  It is updated and includes the Bistro for food and Starbucks coffee.  The only downside here is the parking.  Front area has maybe 12 spaces and second option is a parking garage behind the property.  Rooms were quiet and provided a solid night sleep.  Staff was friendly throughout.  Good location near the airport.  Not much in the area for food options is another slight downside as property connects to one restaurant but no other options are right there.

We stay here (husband and 4 year old son) the night of the 4 of July,we spend the day in Balboa Island and after fireworks we were happy to make it to the hotel, very convenient location, clean and comfortable.

Stayed for one night last week.  This is a nice, newer Courtyard close to Orange County airport.  We stayed here for its location, which was great.  Room was fine, with window that opened, quiet a/c and comfy bed.  A typical and nice courtyard.  The real story of this hotel was the service.  After I had gone to sleep early, my husband went to the lobby a couple of times for the printer and other reasons.  When he got back to the room he couldn't find his wallet.  After looking around and retracing his steps, no wallet.  In the morning he broke the news to me and went online to look up credit card info and start making calls.  Instead, checking email he found a message from the night auditor, Eric Bye, telling him his wallet had been found.  Mr Bye had to find a business card and

Summary Heading: Great location and good value in Irvine!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel in April 2013. Loved this hotel! The new Courtyard concept is great-wide open front desk, Marketplace for breakfast and Starbucks coffee, and the rooms are very recently updated. Love the bright red and gold wallpaper and the amenities we have come to expect from the Courtyard. I got a room with a view of the pool, and wish I had the chance to jump in it-but there were plenty of kids in some sort of school tournament. Family friendly-breakfast is reasonable (not free;() and Starbucks coffee is always available. The firepit is wonderful for the cold California nights. I stayed because of Men Alive concert at Barclay theater which is not far, and relatives party in Irvine the next day which was also nearby. When in the area, check out the 85* (degrees) bakery

I stayed at this Courtyard for the past ten days, and it was a great experience. It all started with the superb customer experience provided by Jim. He went above and beyond to secure my reservation, and he did it with a positive attitude and he was happy to reach out for me. Upon my arrival, he was there to greet me. He remembered my name from our phone conversation, and thru my stay, he always greeted me by name and a smile. He was very personal and held a great conversation. He also had a great knowledge of the area and was able to answer all of my questions.  The rest of the staff that I encountered was also very friendly and helpful.   The hotel is centrally located and has easy access to the highways. It is very easy to get to where you need to go. There are many shopping

Summary Heading: Functional but in need of maintenance
Summary: Spent 5 nights at this hotel this week. It's a typical Courtyard hotel - functional and convenient.  After checking in and getting settled, I happened to glance up at the air duct in the bathroom. It looked like a science project (see photo). I'm not a clean freak and usually don't notice this type of thing, but this one was pretty scary.  I posted the photo to Twitter and Courtyard's social media team responded immediately that they would follow up with management, but it took another 4 days before I actually heard from the hotel manager.  In the interim, I had to use the ironing board, which was broken. Housekeeping quickly came up with another one, so I took that opportunity to show him the vent. He was great about it. He came back 20 minutes later, noting that several other

We (myself, my 4-year-old, and my mom) stayed here our first night in California to be near the Orange County Color Run location. The hotel was clean, comfy, and quiet. The staff was very helpful and accommodating with our request for a late check out so we could clean ourselves up from the Color Run. The room was great with two beds (in a separate room) and a pull out couch. The hotel lobby and cafe area was wonderful and they have an excellent selection of food and drinks. The pool was very nice and my son was able to enjoy a quick swim before we checked out. Quick and easy location just off the freeway. With several shopping and dinning options nearby. Would definitely stay here again if we were back in the area!

We were in Orange County for a family event and this hotel was central for many events.  We had not one complaint. Great beds. Very comfortable. great lobby with lots of places to sit and chat and relax. Outside, ditto. Highly recommended.  We got a great rate through Priceline ($87 a night two queens), which I'm sure helped with my view of our stay. Other benefits: Free parking (and plenty of it), quiet...oh and walking distance to restaurants and shopping if needed.

Stayed here for a night. It was a great Courtyard hotel. The room was large, and nice sleep. The staff was friendly, and the location was perfect to the airport. The best was a free parking.   Checkin was fast and friendly. I had a great sleep for the night. Next morning I drove to the airport for just 5 min. Great location. I will stay at the hotel again next time to fly out from SNA.

I stayed 3 nights and everything about my stay was great.  The room was very clean and had a lovely view of the courtyard.  I didn't have any noise problems and the wi-fi worked perfectly (a necessity since my daughter needed it to write and submit a final exam paper).  The beds are so comfortable. Parking is convenient and complimentary.  I was unfamiliar with the area and the staff was extremely helpful with recommendations and directions.    Get a cup of Starbucks in the morning from the Bistro in the lobby, sit in the courtyard and enjoy the sunshine.  The location is convenient to UV Irvine and great shopping at Fountain Valley Mall and South Coast Plaza.  I'll stay again the next time I'm in the area.

Everything about our stay was perfect. The staff was accomodating even when presented with "above & beyond" requests. The bed was very, very comfortable. In the courtyard there are lovely conversation areas sitting areas one with a fire pit. We enjoyed our stay!

This is the first and last time I ever make a reservation at this Couryard hotel.   The customer service was extremely poor.   I am a gold elite Marriott member and stay at Marriotts all over the country.  My reservation was at the government rate , however somehow I left my government ID at home.  HOWEVER I had all types of other ID as well as business cards , picture ID and assignment papers with government letter head and my name.   However the desk staff and later the manager indicated that they would NOT honor my rate without the actual ID.   They really made me feel devalued. I ended up at the local Newport Marriott and they did a wonderful job recognizing me as a gold elite member and setting me up in a fine room. This is the first and ONLY time I have had this hard of a

We had 20 rooms booked for our wedding at the Irvine Marriott and we stayed there as well. They upgraded us to the Presidential Suite which was amazing to get ready in and have people over after the wedding. The best part of the entire experience was the staff. They were amazing! From the room coordinator, the front desk, the restaurant staff, to the service staff, they went out of their way to make sure everyone had an enjoyable experience.  The lobby is nicely decorated and comfortable and the pool area is great and has new cabanas. We highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: A haven near the John Wayne Airport
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel alone while picking up my daughter at school in Irvine.  It's a little hard to find as it's tucked in behind an apartment complex and a restaurant, but it's very convenient to the 405 and to Jamboree Road, as well as to the John Wayne Airport.  I had gotten a very good AAA deal of $89 a night for a room with free parking and free internet.  The lobby was welcoming and well laid out, with a coffee/drinks bar (which included light food fare, as well), a lounge area and an exit to a lush courtyard with firepits, a pool and a nice grassy area with tropical foliage.  I was asked if a first floor room would be okay, and I said sure, since I was tired and didn't feel like hauling my stuff up the elevator anyway.  To my surprise, I walked into a courtyard

I can't believe how great the customer service was! Even the van driver engaged us in conversation. They offered to give us a ride to local restaurants. The hotel was very nicely taken care of. Great pool and jacuzzi. Great workout room. Super beds and clean rooms. Great restaurants close by. Also, food at hotel restaurant was great too. 5 stas!

Courtyard by Marriott Irvine is not the most posh of places to stay but its got all you need for a business trip or a place to hang out while your hubby is working in the area.  The property is very nice and super clean and wont disappoint. Only donwside are the planes overhead occasionaly. But then  again we picked the area now didnt we? Oh, and the spa nearby (wish I could recall the name) is Fantastic. We will return when next in Irvine.

We stayed here for three nights while visiting relatives in the area. It is conveniently close to the airport, and walking distance (1m) from a strip mall with a few restaurants. The free WiFi actually worked at this hotel, which is a nice change from what I'm used to. The "Bistro" restaurant downstairs is pretty decent, but nothing special. The hot tub and workout room were in good shape, and not busy at all. The showers have a nice shower head with high flow.  We were surprised to come downstairs one late morning to find the restaurant closed. They must have some odd hours during the week days, which is less convenient than one would hope for.  Overall, it was a good stay. There was nothing that really stood out and exceeded our expectations, but there was very little wrong.

Summary Heading: not a long stay but served the purpose
Summary: We used this hotel as a transition night flying out of John Wayne airport.  The airport is quite close and it doesn't take long to get there using the shuttle.  Rooms were standard Marriott Courtyard rooms - clean with comfortable beds.  There was a pool and hot tub but we did not use them.  Issue was that the hotel is in a business district so there are no restaurants nearby (save a very expensive one next door).  There is kind of a little deli thing in the hotel where you can get "bistro" fare and coffee and there is a little "market" to buy a few things.  Staff was friendly and we enjoyed our short stay.

My husband and I recently stayed here over a weekend.  We checked in late on Saturday night and I let the staff member know that I had two separate reservations - One for Saturday night and one for Sunday night.  I asked if he could link them so we wouldn't have to check out and check back in.  He verified that I did have two reservations, but when I asked again about linking the two reservations I was told to just come back the next day to see if we could stay in the same room.  I knew that the hotel had a roll-the-dice program in which Marriott Rewards members can earn extra rewards points, food item, etc.  I asked if they still had the program and was told they were scaling back on the program, but I was finally offered the dice to see what I would get.    Due to my status

We picked this hotel because it was close to the John Wayne Airport and in between the cities of Irvine and Newport Beach. It was located on a good thoroughfare which connected us to several places we wanted to visit. We had a room that overlooked the courtyard, pool and fire pit. The price was reasonable, but my son thought we had a good price because it was during the winter season. It was clean and modern. Breakfast is served, but it is not included in the price of the room. Internet was free! We always appreciate this. I was also glad they were good at recommending places to eat since we were new to the area and had no idea where to start. They handed us a well-organized paper listing the nearby restaurants, the types and the directions. We were there for a pleasure trip,

Summary: The hotel is located a few km from the John Wayne Airport and has easy access to the 405 Freeway. It is not  a few km from the campus of UC Irvine. This hotel was not up to the same standards as the other hotels of the Courtyard Marriott group.  The response on check-in was a bit perfunctory. The "so-called" Main Street is actually a six-lane speedway. There are only a few restaurants within walking distance. Summary: During my stay I was so disappointing with not only the service but lack of sleep I experienced. We were placed in a room that had constant noise from a facility door leading to the outside opening and closing. This was a very important trip for us and not getting any sleep left a sour taste in my mouth. Many amenities were lacking to top it off. Good basic hotel for business or family trips and reasonably priced.  The staff was very professional and friendly.  Location is convenient, close to the 405 freeway.  The late 2:00 p.m. check-out was a nice bonus.

Summary Heading: Good, with walking distance to Irvine Market and other restaurants, free coffee
Summary: I stayed here last year for a work related training and the amenities were good.    It was very convenient and more affordable to get my beer and wine from the Irvine Market liquor store (2540 Main St) that was walking distance from the hotel. I bought a cupcake merlot wine for $8.49 and a 6 pack of shocktop beer for $8.99. So you can compare this to the beer/wine prices at hotel.  I asked the hotel for a corkscrew and they had that for me.    All and all this hotel was close to my training and the Irvine Market walking distance away made my 2 night stay pleasant. Next to the Irvine Market is a few cafes to eat at too. The front-desk was nice too.
Manager Response: Dear Ecomango,   Thank you so much for your review.  We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your time here in Irvine and we made your work trip a little more pleasent for you.     Thank you again! We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Checked in recently and was pleased with the renovations, clean lobby, nice pool, rooms were decent (little loud with foot traffic above).  I give it an average because when I checked in they gave me a key to a room on the 4th floor with a nice view, however, there were still people I'm this room!  I did I a double take and opened the room again and was in some what shock.  Went down to the front desk and informed them of the situation, they apologized and  gave me a room on the 2nd floor but when i opened the blinds there were two huge trees as my view- Coming from NY in the winter, i just wanted a little SoCal sunshine and had originally requested a room with a view so I asked if they could move me to a a room comparable to the initial room and was told someone would be right
Manager Response: Dear MrVD44,   Thank you so much for your review.  Your feedback is truly appreciated. If you would be so kind as to contact me via email at cindy.han-reta@marriott.com, I would love to hear a little more about your experience.    I look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: Even though this and the other hotels in the area appeared to be sold out, I was able to get a reservation becuase of the Marriotts Rewards program.  The price was very good and the location was convenient to SNA airport, but not too close to be noisy.  The lobby has been updated with a modern design and has a good cafe for breakfast and light dinner.  Very comfortable to hang out in as is the fire pit area in the courtyard.   Rooms were comfortable, but the bathroom would be small for more than one person.
Manager Response: Dear Corrine F,   Thank you so much for your review.  We appreciate your great feedback. We are glad you were able to enjoy your time here as well as save a few dollars! We take great pride in our service as well as our product and your review validates all of our hardwork.    Thank you so much and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary Heading: A reasonable choice for a weekend at for this neighborhood
Summary: We stayed here over a weekend night and it was very good for the purpose of our visit. A nice lobby and a nice bar... Breakfast was obviously for a fee only, free coffee in the lobby was provided ONLY for FEW hours (most of the time there was no free coffee in the lobby). Front desk receptionist was kind. Room space was very good, bed, aircondition and free WiFi were very good.   We reached the hotel by a car, did not fly in/out SNA. We picked this Courtyard hotel over the nearby SpringHill's  because of a lower weekend rate.   On  previous visits to this neighborhood, I wrote two very good reviews about the nearbt SpringHill hotel, however since then... the hotel raised its weekend rate.
Manager Response: Dear marathon308,   Thank you so much for your review.  We are happy to hear you were able to take advantage of a few of our amenities while staying with us.  We take great pride in both our product and service and we are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy both.    We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: I stayed here after a late arriving flight at John Wayne-the Marriott was super expensive so chose this option, whose price point was reasonable.  I had to wait to check in as the desk clerk found an envelope for a guy (not a guest) picking up an envelope, going through seeing his ID and verifying info, etc. It was late and I found this not to be the greatest example of customer service.  Room was clean, but not as spacious as another courtyard I had stayed at several days before. In am had to wait for server at bistro about 5 minutes or so to show up; I don't find lax service such as what has mentioned to be out of the ordinary for Orange County, but this seemed to be systemic with every experience I had in the hotel; no one in too big of a hurry to help. You may contact me directly via email at cindy.han-reta@marriott.com.    I look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Courtyard on Main St. The front desk staff was so friendly and welcoming. I stayed in a one bedroom room on the first floor and it was quiet. As with the Marriott chain, the room was clean and comfortable. Loved the bed and the free wifi, free parking is also available here. The Courtyard is a hop, skip and a jump from SNA if you're flying in. There's quite a few shopping centers within driving distance to get some food if you choose to opt out from the Bistro that is in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear Greg J,   Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We appreciate your comments and we are happy to see that you enjoyed your time here with us.  We take pride in both our service and product so your feedback is welcomed.    Thank you so much, we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: This was a very nice Courtyard with the Bistro upgrade.  The rooms were very clean and I had one facing the courtyard.  It was nice to have a patio to sit on in the evenings after work.  The staff was friendly and accomodating.  I was there for a conference at the Hyatt across the street.  It was an easy walk and in a good location.
Manager Response: Dear KellyHouston,   Thank you so much for your review. We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback.  When you are alway from home on business, we like to keep our guests as comfortble and relaxed as possible.  Our staff takes great pride in our service and hotel so we are happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us.    Thank you again! We hope to welcome you back soon!   Best,   Cindy

Summary Heading: Not for those who need good Internet
Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard Irvine on a Sunday at a weekend special rate. We were in room 303 with a view of the office building next door. The room was smaller than in Courtyards where we had stayed on this trip (Kahului, Maui and San Diego's Liberty Station). It had a chair-width porch without chairs.  We didn't buy breakfast with the room.  Pluses •	The bed and pillows were very comfortable •	Many wall plugs for charging our various devices •	Free coffee downstairs •	The TV screen was very large with good selection of channels •	Refrigerator, coffee maker •	Air conditioner blows over the desk and TV, not over the bed  Minuses •	The free in-room wi-fi was very sluggish, and sometimes I was unable to attach files to e-mails. Probably the bandwidth doesn't fit the traffic. Maybe
Manager Response: Dear Staidhere,   Thank you so much for your feedback. We always appreciate comments that will help us better the stays of our future guests.  I apologize that the internet was sluggish and the noise from your bathroom woke up your wife, I will make sure our Engineering department looks into it.  We will make sure to look into the specific room that you stayed in and see what we can do to elevate those issues.    Thank you again for your feedback, we look forward to meeting your expectations on your next visit.    Best,   Cindy H.

Summary: We stay at this property when we are flying out of SNA, since our flights are always early morning.  We  really like the location and the pool!  We usually arrive early afternoon and spend a few hours at the pool before getting dinner and returning our rental car - By staying here we pay for one less day of the rental car.  The hotel has a free shuttle to/from SNA.  It leaves the hotel every half hour, on the hour.  When I called for airport pick-up after returning our car I was informed that the shuttle driver had just gone on his half hour break.  Staff member told me to take a taxi and the hotel would pay for it.  (My husband decided we should walk.... I would NOT recommend this as you take your life in your hands trying to get out of the airport!  That said, it took us about

Summary: The rooms are clean,  high speed internet, great location, clean bathroom, good breakfast, good pool,  excellent service, nice neighborhood it´s really close from every place. Everything is perfect there, we´ll definitely go back.

Summary: Stayed here for a soccer tournament. It is perfect for a quick overnight stay. Clean rooms, nice big pool area, comfortable bed. . Missed the free breakfast. It is a perfect location right off the freeway and plenty of restaurants nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Ricci W,   Thank you for your review, we appreciate you taking the time to give our hotel a great review.  We are happy to hear you were able to make use of our many amenties on your short visit to Irvine.   We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Hotel and the staff were great! I came here to teach a class in one of their banquet rooms and everything was great. I checked into my room the day before and it was spacious and well kept. The free internet was also great! The only issue was the meeting room for the class, it was either too hot or too cold however the facilities person was prompt in fixing the issue.   Lunch came from their cafe..which was very good and everyone enjoyed. The breakfast and coffee service were also well received.   The standards I would expect out of Marriott Courtyard...they didn't let me down.
Manager Response: Dear Rottwyler,   Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  We pride ourselves in both service and product and are happy to hear we exceeded your expectations on both accounts.    We hope to welcome you and your class back soon!   Have a wonderful week!

Summary: To begin hotel management emailed me a week before notifying that the hotel was under construction and offered apologies for the inconvience. I responded and requested newly renovated rooms which were provided upon check-in.  Arrived at hotel around 9pm on 7/13/812 after driving in from LA, was immediately greeted by  very friendly, professional staff (can't remember her name middle aged blonde)!!! Speedy and simple check in she gave the description and directions to our rooms and provided us with local shopping and restaurant information. Rooms were newly renovated, clean and spacious!!! We booked the King Suites which were much bigger than my first apartment!!! The rooms had separate living areas with mini-fridge, coffee pot, tv, desk, sofa bed, and private balcony. Our room

We are so proud of our newly renovated room so we are happy to hear you were able to enjoy it.    Let us know when you return and we will make sure you get a room close to the parking structure!   We look forward to welcoming you back! Thank you again!

Summary: The location of this hotel would lead one to believe it is dedicated to the business traveler, but my wife and I enjoyed a weekend at this upscale Courtyard.  The room was like most Courtyards---ours having gone thru a recent renovation, with an OK bathroom and additional mirror outside of the bathroom.  King-size bed and pillows, very comfy and the air conditioner relatively quiet and responsive.  The room with a chair, sofa and writing/computing desk is large enough for the furniture without feeling cramped.  Good news is a combo lobby bar and food service bar.  Food and beverage till 10pm each night.  The morning B'fast is not free, but the in-room WIFI is along with parking. Summary: My family stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend and really enjoyed it. First, it is located conveniently near the highway making it easy to get to. It also was easy to hop on and travel to nearby attractions and cities. The hotel is about a year old and is in excellent condition. The rooms are spacious and the mini-fridge was a nice bonus. The lobby is inviting and warm with an interactive electronic information board for the guest to use. It's located across the street from a small plaza that houses a few restaurants and a Juice it Up where my daughter and I got some of the most delicious smoothies we ever had...seriously! Back to the hotel, though. The staff was kind, professional and helpful whenever we approached them...we felt right at home to be honest. My one issue

Summary Heading: 4 star -clean, professional, friendly staff, well designed spaces
Summary: I stayed here recently while my kitchen and bathrooms were being remodeled and I have to say I was surprised that it was as good as it was.  They are also doing a room renovation but the crew was quiet and respectful of guests.  The lobby lounge and cafe is fantastic, great help from front desk to housekeeping, everyone is nice.  The pool area and fire pit is awesome, clean, well kept and pretty too.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  free wifi and parking is easy in the free lot.  Great location in center of Irvine right off the 405 - can't go wrong, prefer this over the hyatt for easy come and go access.  I'm giving 4 stars + very good not because this is like a 4 seasons, it's not it's a simple, clean, friendly little hotel that knows Hospitality.  They run a quality operation.
Manager Response: Dear BRH949,   Thank you so much for the wonderful review.  We are so delighted to hear you enjoyed your time with us.  I will personally share your review with our staff to make sure their efforts are rewarded. Thank you again!   We look forward to welcoming you back!   Have a great week!   Cindy H.

Summary: Definitely better than average for the price and star rating.  They have done a fantastic renovation in the lobby and added in a very cozy cafe and seating area.  Modern, clean, business traveler friendly and fun.  The rooms are equally decorated and for the price, quite nice.  My only complaint would be the beds.  You definitely notice the difference between higher star rated hotels and lower ones when it comes to the comfort of the beds and the softness of the linens.  If you are not USED to high quality linens and a better mattress, this may not be an issue for you.
Manager Response: Dear KoziakProductions,   Thank you so much for all the wonderful compliments. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! We take pride in both our service and product and we appreciate your hotel patronage.    We hope to welcome you back soon!   Cindy H.  Courtyard by Marriott John Wayne Airport

Summary: stayed here just 2 weeks ago for a weekend.  I received a terrible room 103 near the lobby and elevator so this time I was requested a room in the back close to the parking garage.  Checked in Wed no problem.  On Friday construction on the entire 4th floor began.  The back elevator was closed during the day as the construction hours were 8 to 6.  There was no notice of the construction BEFORE arriving at the hotel otherwise we would of stayed somewhere else.  No one wants to hear drilling and banging on their weekend getaway!  So beware!  The room was fine the shower pressure was awful!  Enjoyed sitting at the pool, but the pool towels need to be actual pool towels.  Overall would not stay here again until the construction is completely done which as the hotel flyer said should
Manager Response: Dear getmarshall,   Thank you for your review. We are so sorry to hear about your most recent experience with us.  The hotel has been diligently contacting each of our guests one week prior to their check in via email or phone (whichever contact information is provided while the reservation was being made) regarding our renovation.  We apologize if you were not contacted and we apologize for any disturbance you may have experienced during your stay because of this.     You also mentioned some other areas of improvement in your review and I would love to discuss them with you further.  The Courtyard Irvine strives for an excellent guest experience so any feedback you have is appreciated. We will use that feedback to better serve you and our future guests.  You may contact me via email at cindy.han@marriott.com at anytime.   I look forward to hearing from you.   Best,   Cindy H.

Summary: We stayed there just for the night. Clean, quiet, reasonably priced. Parking and WiFi are free. Very good bed. Parkade is 50' from the back door, not unlike in many other similar hotels. Just a perfect night stay.
Manager Response: Dear Andre-RT715,   Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a 4 point rating!  We appreciate your kind words and we are so happy to hear you enjoye your stay.   We hope to welcome you back soon!   Cindy H.

Summary Heading: Closer to a Super 8 than a Marriott.
Summary: The king size bed was short (I am tall), the room was very small (which sometimes is the case when you rent a room with a kingsize bed.  They jam  it into smaller room) and the the mold on the tile in the shower needed to be cleaned.  When I told the front desk of the need to clean it on Friday evening, it was still there on Sunday when I checked out.   We had two rooms, and the double queen room was a bit larger, but the hotel was a bit run down. Not worth the discounted $105 per room per night that we paid (plus tax).  Noisy, too. Work out room small and poorly equipped.

I can't over state how wonderful and accommodating the staff were to me. Everyone was extremely friendly and courteous. One of the nicest hotel experiences that I can remember.  The hotel is beautiful, and the room was nice (nothing special but very clean and comfortable. I stayed at the hotel for two nights during a business trip. Excellent location, near the airport, restaurants and close to the malls.

I am here in this hotel now as I write this review. The hotel is a great location for Irvine and Santa Ana. It is a fairly typical Courtyard. As one of the other reviewers mentioned it is clean and well maintained. The flat screens are large and the beds comfortable. The meeting rooms are nice if you need one and the service is good. The food is quite good here and the staff one of the friendliest and most helpful. The food service is in the lobby and though they have nice tables, chairs and flat screens for you to view, it is not a full service restaurant, it is a food counter. I would recommend this hotel as an excellent choice for a business stay. There are a lot of restaurants in the area to choose from. There is an excellent Houston's close by. I did not find the hotel to

This is a good, your regular Marriot. I stayed here on business for two days.   The location is excellent as the hotel is right next to the freeways (yet private and quiet), so it's easy to reach. Everything around Irvine is easily accessible. Everything from the malls to restaurants are just a few miles away from the hotel.  The hotel has a fast-food type of restaurant, so the breakfast was adequate, but the coffee was ok. You can also get light dinner here and drinks. There's enough restaurants around that I didnt eat much at the hotel.  The patio is nice and well-maintained with pool. There's a gym adjacent to the pool and it's got a basic set of weights and several cardio machines.  All in all, the hotel is very much a business hotel and works well for that. The double room

As a platinum member of Marriott, this hotel is where myself and family always stay for personal trips to LA.  Easy to get to Hollywood and to see friends in Burbanka nd Glendale.  Stay here 4-5 times a year.  Staff is friendly.

Stayed here 4 nights for a tradeshow.  Rooms were very nice, clean, roomy and comfortable.  If you're looking for a hot shower, you will be happy!  The shower was hot and a nice strong spray from the shower head, rarely found on the road.  The bistro was very nice, good food and quick service.  The free coffee is really good, but it's hidden behind a large tv area.  The fitness room was small, crowded and way too hot with no way to adjust a fan or the temperature.  We had to prop the door open, 4 people were in there and it was a smelly sauna.  It was very busy in there, I had to wait at 530am to use a treadmill.  Staff was very cordial and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: This place is SO MUCH BETTER than HOWARD JOHNSON's!
Summary: We made the mistake of checking into the Howard Johnson's on Katella in Orange before spending a bit more and switching to the Marriott.  I was in town for a health issues & doctor visits and let me tell you the Marriott is A+ for staff attitude and they were so, so helpful.  Much better than the previous night at Ho Jo's.  Rooms are spotless and welcoming....no bugs, no stench, no filth in the carpet.  A place that's taken care of and the staff seem proud to work there!

Clean new rooms and good service. I was here for a few nights and the only disappointments were the rather small pillows (they provided 4 pillows but each was a rather small 'standard size' rather than queen or king size. Also, after coming from the cold of Chicago, I had no need for a 4 inch thick duvette in sunny southern CA hotel room. Even with the AC cranked to COLD, the dujvette was just too hot. Sounds a little petty but if you are only in the room to sleep you want to choose your comfort level. For me the duvette was just 'too hot' and I had  a hard time sleeping.

Summary Heading: There are better Marriott options in Irvine
Summary: I stayed here in early Jan 2012. The lobby is nice...but the rooms are dated and not in great shape. Residence Inn and Springhill Suites in Irvine provide nicer rooms at a similar price. I wouldn't stay here again.
Conveniently located off the highway with restaurants / shops nearby. Lobby was nice but rooms could use some updating.

Summary Heading: Hope Next Years Convention Is Elsewhere.
Summary: Stayed here for a convention. Good rate for room for a cpl. Had no fridge or micro. Have exp. eye medication requiring constant refridg. Req. mini frg from hotel. Nvr got1. Needless to say, tried to keep it iced but had to go to other flrs. to get ice. In 4 days, never ice on my flr or 2 above. My ovr $200 gloucoma drops got warm. Eye spec. appt day aft conv. put pressure in both eyes @ ovr 23, both eyes (bad). Dr gave new rx & sample,told me to toss container exposed to heat. 2 wks ltr pressure @ 12, both eyes. Also req. veg. fare per conv. sheet. Pretty shoddy fare. Eggs runny, fruit in shrt supply, yougurt & juice running out. No variety. Lunch had lunchmeat & dried out bread. Banquet dinner a fiasco. People that ordered sea bass got sick , at least 40%. Veg fare laughable.

Good location by the airport and freeway and lots of dining/shopping opportunities.  It appears to be very new, with good internet and TV. Courteous staff. Starbucks, beer and wine are a positive.  Good value when I stayed on a Friday night.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for both business people and families
Summary: I stayed here because of the location -- near Orange County airport -- and the price. This is a very good quality hotel for both business people and families. The rooms are clean and efficient.  There are plenty of electric outlets for computers, etc. There is a nice bistro downstairs that is open for breakfast and dinner, with very reasonable prices (and yet more electric outlets at many of the tables). I saw several families enjoying this hotel -- they have internal connecting rooms in at least the room I stayed in.   Two other great things:  Free WiFi and plenty of free self-parking.

Summary Heading: Just fine, just what you expect.
Summary: The usual, exactly what you'd expect from a Courtyard.  This ones pretty new and up to date.

This new CY, very close to John Wayne airport, is a great property. It fills the need for another Marriott property close to SNA for all you Marriot Rewards junkies.  This CY follows their new layout plan--the lobby/cafe is bright and airy, with lots of meeting areas and booths. The breakfast offerings were good, and it was cool to sit down with a beer in a CY lobby after a day of meetings.  The rooms were spotless and showcase all of the latest technologies that Marriot has been putting into their properties.  This has now become my preferred property when I'm visiting Irvine or Santa Ana.

Summary Heading: Wonderful, clean and quiet hotel and friendly staff
Summary: Excellent, friendly staff from the time we checked in until after we left. They made an effort to find something I left behind and I really appreciated it.  Room was very clean and quiet, the bed was wonderful.  The rooms have private balconies.  It's about a mile from John Wayne airport but we felt like we were miles away, never heard airport noise.   Nice size jacuzzi.  Even though we used points(this was an unexpected trip), they gave us very nice rooms.   Lobby has several computers for printing airline boarding passes.   They have mini fridge's in the room.

This hotel is located very near to John Wayne Airport which also goes by Orange County Airport, Santa Ana Airport, SNA.  It's easy to get to and they have an airport shuttle.  I rented a car so didn't use the shuttle.  The room was clean and your basic Courtyard ambiance.  I like the location as I work in Irvine.  The gym had a few cardios and the dumb bells.

Don't really understand the negative reviews for this hotel.  I had quite an enjoyable stay here earlier this year.  I visit the area frequently for work, and love my Marriott Rewards points! The Marriott Irvine was booked up, so we went ahead and stayed at the Courtyard.  You're not going to get the complete Marriott experience as its a little bit more limited than the Marriott Irvine, but still a pretty good deal for what it is.  I'd definitely stay again.

This is a standard Courtyard property. Everything is as you'd expect. What makes this place nice is they have a snack bar/restaurant in the lobby, that prepares your meals, and nice seating areas. The food is pretty good, if you want a sandwich or an easy breakfast. This place also has a nice seating area outside, with a fire pit. So you can take your food, or just your drink from the bar (full service) and relax outside. The value is average, but it's a great location to John Wayne airport and only 25 minutes to Long Beach airport.   The drive to beaches is also not that far, so the location is pretty good.

Very modern and hip lobby.  Rooms are standard fare -- like 90% of other couryards.  The place was a "good" courtyard with very friendly staff.  My only complaint is the workout room which was small for a hotel of this size.

Summary Heading: Not Up to Usual Marriott Standards - Not Worth the Price Either
Summary: Spent two nights here on a business trip - won't again.  Central location, but can't get to it right off the street, have to find your way through the entrance through a business park, but that's no big deal.  Very busy area (Jamboree and Main), very noisy, even in the early morning.   Very nice lobby area, welcoming and friendly staff, very nice courtyard area, (where a resident rabbit hopped out to greet me!) etc. They have a few parking spaces out front, but you'll likely end up in the garage out back, not a huge issue, but if I were alone at night it could be a bit creepy.     The room itself is a bit "tired," particularly the bathroom. Very disappointed in the amenities, frankly you get better ones at a Comfort Inn, for half the price.  Lots of scuff marks on the molding,

For a hotel close to the airport, this place is great. The entrance doesn't pop right out at you due to the construction, but it's on the corner and not that hard to find. Front desk staff was more than helpful and accomodated our needs almost immediately. Bathroom/closet area is a bit small, but for a short stay is fine.

Stayed here 5 days for a business trip.  Irvine is a really  safe and easy city to get around.  The hotel is close to many restaurants, business parks and shopping centers.  It's adjacent to 2 office towers and parking ramps.  The elevator was not functional the day I needed to check out, very inconvenient.  The lobby is newly renovated and the business center is equipped with 4+ computer, which is very nice. It is a bit expensive, but that's typical of Irvine.

Summary Heading: Way too Expensive - Construction All Around - Update Lobby
Summary: First off, the lobby in this "traditional" Courtyard is recently renovated.  When I mean tradition, I mean the rooms are designed around a central courtyard with pool and spa.  The lobby has over 8 computers although download speeds were pretty slow in my opinion.  The lobby had a "bistro" still cafe.  I did not try the food.  I only stayed one night.  I drove in late for an early meeting with a client.  The rooms were your typical courtyard.  Very dissappointed with the TV.  A 19-inch CRT Philipps TV.  Are you kidding me?   The room did have a refrigerator, both wired and wireless internet.  Room was clean and bed comfortable.  There is construction going on right next to the hotel.  Taking up all the convenient parking in front of the hotel.  You have to park in the back and

Great location, nice pool, front desk staff was VERY accomodating!!  There's construction on the street in front of it so its a little confusing to get there but lets be honest, we're adults and can figure out how to get to the parking lot.  Great breakfast and I got food poisoning from a restaurant in laguna beach so the next morning the kitchen made me home made applesauce because thats all I could digest...I thought that was WAY beyond the call of duty and I won't forget it.  Another good Courtyard property!

Summary Heading: Good Location, Good Value, Clean Modern
Summary: I like Courtyard Hotels...  Good clean rooms, Good value, No pompous staff or pretence, just good clean value hotel, with nice open courtyard surroundings.  This hotel is no different.  Good location, close to restuarants and freeways etc.  Easy to find, on the corner of intersection of Jamboree and Main Street.

When we checked in the front desk staff was extremely pleasant and efficient. Our two requests were ignored (a low floor and a refridgerator in our room.  I'm glad we brought our travel fridge.)  The parking situation is a disaster if you have more than one or two pieces of light luggage.  There are two parking areas, one at the very front of the hotel with very limited parking (maybe 20 spots) that fill up extremely quickly.  The other is a parking garage with no direct access to the hotel.  There's actually NO entrance facing the parking garage.  There are two luggage carts at the front desk for use, but no help is available.  I suggest packing light.  There are only two elevators in the hotel, essentially at opposite ends of the hotel.    The hotel room itself is rather small

We stayed at this hotel when we went to Disneyland earlier this month. The distance to Disneyland was not bad at all. We were impressed with the room because it had a couch rather than just a chair and there seemed to be plenty of room. The room was modernly decorated. We didn't see any bugs and the hotel seemed to be in good condition. Some things that did not impress us were: the buffet looked like something I have seen at hotels with complimentary breakfasts. It is not worth the $9.95 pp they charge. Because of this, we went to McDonalds every day, which is just down the street. Also-something that really grossed me out was that the maid actually re-folded our wet towels both days she cleaned and hung them back up. I have previously stayed at hotels where there was a small

This is close by hotel to the orange county airport, clean, easy to get to from the airport- if you are going to Disneyland it is not very close- 30-45 minutes in traffic. Not a hotel for families- better for business people.

We spent two nights at the Courtyard in early October and the hotel was very nice.  The rooms are clean and enough space for two people to stay comfortably.  I believe they have just refurbished the rooms and the beds were very comfortable.  The hotel staff was very attentive and friendly.  The location of the hotel is great and the area seems to be fairly quiet.  Irvine is a nice area and very safe.  Lots of things to do in the area.  If you are going to Disneyland, stay here and make the short drive.

Located near the SNA airport and many large office buildings in Irvine, this property is currently undergoing major upgrades to the new Courtyard room standard. The carpets are changed out and a new twin sofa bed is in place. The sink and counter are also upgraded and the shower head is a nicer model. The big improvement is the bed, as the 4" foam mattress is replaced with a normal height model, similar to the ones being deployed in the mainline Marriott properties (but not, alas, up to the Renaissance standards). A new comforter is in place; alas, it is still cheap nylon, but is has a bit more stuffing. Down pillows are also standard.  The restaurant was closed during my stay - I do not know when it will re-open. The rennovations should be complete in the spring of 2004.
